0.title: Plum announces its Birthday Bash sale with discounts of up to 50%
0.article_body: 100% vegan beauty and personal care brand Plum has announced its biggest sale of the season, 'The Plum Birthday Bash', from July 1 to 4. The brand is offering discounts of up to 50% along with exciting freebies worth ₹1,500, Plum stated, adding that one lucky winner stands a chance to win an iPhone 13 every day.

1.title: Mumbai sees waterlogging, traffic jams amid rains; orange alert issued
1.article_body: Amid heavy rains on Thursday, several parts of Mumbai witnessed waterlogging and traffic jams. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert for Mumbai predicting heavy to very heavy showers over the next two days. Mumbai received 119.09 mm of rain from 8 am to 8 pm on Thursday, as per the city's civic body.

2.title: Ashwin has had Stokes' measure a lot over his career: Watson on 5th Test
2.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he is "really looking forward" to the battle between Ravichandran Ashwin and England Test captain Ben Stokes in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Ashwin has had his measure a lot over his career," added Watson. "Ashwin is going to be the main man to try and make the most of that battle," he stated.

3.title: You never know who you’ll run into in New York: Bill Gates on meeting Mahesh, Namrata
3.article_body: After actor Mahesh Babu shared a picture of himself and his wife Namrata Shirodkar meeting Bill Gates, the Microsoft Co-founder said, "Being in New York is always fun." He added, "You never know who you’ll run into. It was great meeting you and Namrata!" Mahesh responded, "Honour is all ours, Mr Gates! One of our favourite moments ever."

4.title: Govt hikes import tax on gold from 7.5% to 12.5% amid declining rupee
4.article_body: The central government has raised the basic import tax on gold to 12.5% from 7.5% as the Indian rupee declined to a record low. India, the world's second-biggest consumer of gold, imported gold worth $6.03 billion in May, a nine-fold rise from a year earlier. Notably, last year the Centre had cut the tax to 7.5% in the Budget.

5.title: 'Strange' cloud hangs over Ukraine's Kyiv, video of dry thunderstorm goes viral
5.article_body: A video of a dry thunderstorm in Ukraine's capital Kyiv has gone viral on social media. Olexander Scherba, a former Ukrainian diplomat, tweeted, "The whole Kyiv saw and heard the strange cloud hanging over the city. Thunder and lightning without storm." Reacting to the video, a user tweeted, "Guardians of the Galaxy!"

6.title: I'm done with 'Tanu Weds...', don't want to go back to being Manu: Madhavan
6.article_body: R Madhavan, on being asked if he'd be returning as Manu in another 'Tanu Weds Manu' movie, said he's done with the franchise and doesn't want to go back to being Manu now. "There's no point in beating a dead horse," he added. "If it's...sequel to Avengers...it's easier because you've a template...But with Tanu Weds Manu, it's impossible," said Madhavan.

7.title: Always playing a hero is boring: John on playing villain in Ek Villain Returns
7.article_body: John Abraham, speaking about doing a negative role in 'Ek Villain Returns', said, "Always playing a hero is boring...It's good to play...villain." He added it's kind of a homecoming for him as he played a character with a negative shade in his 2003 film 'Jism'. John further said he loved the script when he heard it for the first time.

8.title: Drugs worth ₹58.84 cr seized in Mumbai so far this year: Police
8.article_body: The Mumbai Police has seized over 1,000 kg of drugs worth ₹58.84 crore in the city from January till May this year. Police also arrested 4,968 people for their alleged involvement in drug-related offences during the period. According to data provided by the police, the most valued seized drugs include mephedrone (MD) worth ₹18 crore and heroin worth ₹11.94 crore.

9.title: Hyd startup successfully tests satellite deployer on ISRO's PSLV C53
9.article_body: Hyderabad-based space tech startup Dhruva Space has successfully tested and space-qualified its satellite orbital deployer (DSOD 1U) which was aboard ISRO's PSLV C53 on June 30. Dhruva Space utilised the PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM) for the test. The successful test has laid the path for the startup's satellite missions, Thybolt-1 and Thybolt-2, which would be onboard PSLV C54 mission.

10.title: We beat NZ who're the world's best team but India are different: Stokes
10.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he considers New Zealand whom his team defeated 3-0 in the recently concluded Test series as the "best team in the world". "India are obviously a completely different opposition [and] a different dynamic of a team," stated Stokes. England will take on India in the fifth rescheduled Test which starts today.

11.title: Root can surpass Tendulkar's record of most Test runs: Compton
11.article_body: Former English cricketer Nick Compton has said that batter Joe Root can surpass former India batter Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket. "I think he can. He's (Root) young and is right up there with Tendulkar in terms of runs scored at 31 [years of age]...If he can keep going like this, he'll get there," Compton said.

12.title: I think Fadnavis didn't accept Maha Deputy CM post happily: Pawar
12.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar claimed on Thursday that he doesn't think that former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis accepted the Deputy CM post "happily", adding, "His facial expression said it all." "[Fadnavis] must have followed...orders from the top," he also claimed. Furthermore, he alleged that rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde "himself had no idea" that he'd get the CM post.

13.title: Ketanji Jackson sworn in, becomes 1st Black woman on US Supreme Court
13.article_body: Ketanji Brown Jackson has been sworn in as a US Supreme Court justice, becoming the first black woman to serve on the nation's highest court. "Her historic swearing-in...represents a profound step forward for our nation, for all...young, Black girls who now see themselves reflected on our highest court, and for all of us as Americans," US President Joe Biden said.

14.title: Kohli will get the ton he's 'desperate' for if he scores 30: Vaughan
14.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Virat Kohli will score the century he has been "desperately" seeking for a "long period of time", if he scores 30 runs in the upcoming fifth rescheduled Test against England. "Just go back a few years when he produced one of the greatest Test match centuries [at Edgbaston]. I think he's due," added Vaughan.

15.title: Rupee hits fresh record low of 79.12 against US dollar
15.article_body: Amid a strengthening dollar and rising global crude oil prices, the Indian rupee hit a fresh record low of 79.12 against the US dollar after the currency opened at 78.98 in Friday's session. The rupee had touched the 79-mark for the first time ever after it closed at a record low of 79.03 against the US dollar on Wednesday.

16.title: Ex-Apple exec's firm files for bankruptcy months after going public
16.article_body: Former Apple and JC Penney executive Ron Johnson-led retail startup Enjoy Technology has filed for bankruptcy, months after going public through a special-purpose acquisition company (SPAC). The startup plans to sell its US assets to technology repair company Asurion. A court filing has said that Enjoy has struggled with declining liquidity and an inability to retain staff.

17.title: SpaceX gets nod to use its Starlink internet on boats, planes in US
17.article_body: The US FCC has authorised Elon Musk-owned SpaceX to use its Starlink satellite internet system on moving vehicles, like trucks, boats and aircraft. "Authorising a new class of terminals for SpaceX's satellite system will expand the range of broadband capabilities to meet the growing user demands," the FCC said. SpaceX has launched over 2,500 Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit.

18.title: Woman, lover arrested for killing aunt, her son over ₹4 lakh loan in UP
18.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly killing her 40-year-old aunt and the latter's 18-year-old son in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. The accused were unable to repay a loan of ₹4 lakh taken from victims almost a year ago, police added. This comes three months after the bodies of the victims were found floating in a canal.

19.title: Daily wager electrocuted to death while disconnecting 11kV wire in Gurugram
19.article_body: A daily wager died of electrocution while trying to disconnect a 11kV wire from an electric pole in Gurugram. The deceased, Sheikh Chotu (27), was asked by a private firm's officials to disconnect high-tension wires, police said. Meanwhile, the two employees of the firm have been booked. Notably, this is the second such death within a fortnight in the city.

20.title: Don't gather at ED office: Raut to Sena workers ahead of questioning
20.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has tweeted that he'll appear before Enforcement Directorate (ED) today at 12 noon and appealed to his party workers to "not gather" at the agency's office. Raut is being questioned by ED in a money laundering case linked to Patra Chawl redevelopment scam. "I respect [ED's summons]...it's my duty to co-operate with...investigation agencies," he said.

21.title: Ban on single-use plastic items in India comes into effect from today
21.article_body: The ban on single-use plastic items in India has come into effect from today. The ban prohibits manufacture, import, stocking, distribution, sale and use of the following identified single-use plastic items, which have low utility and high littering potential. The single-use plastic items prohibited include earbuds, straws, plates, cups, forks, spoons and knives, among other items.

22.title: Actor Kamal Haasan receives UAE's Golden Visa
22.article_body: The United Arab Emirates has given Golden Visa to actor Kamal Haasan. Vijay Sethupathi, Trisha, Mohanlal, Mammootty, Tovino Thomas, Dulquer Salmaan and Jayasurya are among other members of the South Indian film fraternity who have received the visa. The Golden Visa permits long-term (5 and 10 years) residency for foreigners.

23.title: Steak, sausage can't be used to describe vegetarian food: France
23.article_body: France will become the first European Union country to ban the use of meat names like "steak" and "sausage" to describe plant-based food, according to an official decree. "It'll not be possible to use sector-specific terminology traditionally associated with meat and fish to designate products that don't belong to the animal world and which, in essence, aren't comparable," decree read.

24.title: Man on scooter throws bomb at CPI(M) headquarters in Kerala; video surfaces
24.article_body: A man on a scooter threw a crude bomb at the Kerala headquarters of the ruling CPI(M) on Thursday night in Thiruvananthapuram. The video of the incident shows that the bomb exploded in front of the main gate of the party office. Reportedly, several CPI(M) leaders were at an apartment near the office at the time of the attack.

25.title: India sees 17,070 new COVID-19 cases, 1,749 less than yesterday
25.article_body: India recorded 17,070 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to latest data by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,819 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,07,189, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,139, according to the latest data.

26.title: Reliance to launch British sandwich & coffee chain Pret A Manger in India
26.article_body: Reliance Industries on Thursday said it will be opening outlets of British sandwich and coffee chain Pret A Manger in India, marking its first foray into the food and beverage retail business. The first outlet would reportedly open in Mumbai before March 2023. Pret A Manger, whose name means "ready to eat" in French, first opened in London in 1986.

27.title: Nadal enters 3rd round of Wimbledon after beating Ricardas Berankis
27.article_body: Rafael Nadal entered Wimbledon's third round after beating world number 106 Ricardas Berankis, which marked his 307th win in a Grand Slam match. Nadal made 39 unforced errors and recorded 35 winners in the match whose scoreline read 6-4, 6-4, 4-6, 6-3. Nadal lost the third set having won the opening two sets marking the second instance in two matches.

28.title: Eknath Shinde changes Twitter profile pic to one with Bal Thackeray after becoming CM
28.article_body: After taking oath as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Eknath Shinde changed the profile picture of his Twitter handle to one with Bal Thackeray. Shinde had earlier said that Uddhav Thackeray had diluted the Hindutva ideology of Bal Thackeray by forming a coalition with Sharad Pawar's Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the Congress, which he called an "unnatural alliance".

29.title: Situation in India a cause for fear, there is a reason to be afraid now: Amartya Sen
29.article_body: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen has said, "I think if someone asks me if I'm scared of something, I would say 'yes'. There is a reason to be afraid now. The current situation in India has become a cause for fear." "India cannot be of Hindus only. Again, Muslims alone cannot make India. Everyone has to work together," he added.

30.title: There are people at Meta who shouldn't be here: Zuckerberg on hiring cuts
30.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg while informing his employees about the hiring cuts at the company this year, remarked, "There are probably a bunch of people at the company who shouldn't be here." Speaking about "turning up the heat" on performance, "I think some of you might decide that this place isn't for you, and that self-selection is okay with me."

31.title: Cryptocurrencies are a clear danger: RBI Governor
31.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday described cryptocurrencies as a "clear danger", adding, "Anything that derives value based on make-believe, without any underlying, is just speculation under a sophisticated name." In the foreword to the 25th issue of the Financial Stability Report (FSR), Das also noted that as the financial system gets increasingly digitalised, cyber risks are growing.

32.title: Google to pay $90 mn to settle case with developers over app store
32.article_body: Google has agreed to pay $90 million to settle a case with app developers for allegedly violating antitrust laws and harming developers through app store policies. It allegedly used its deal with smartphone makers, technical barriers and revenue-sharing agreements to close the app ecosystem. Google has said it would put $90 million in a fund to support certain developers.

33.title: 2 B'luru policemen save boy attempting to die by suicide; rewarded
33.article_body: Two police officers in Bengaluru, ASI Ramesh and HC Chandrashekhar, were rewarded after they saved a boy who was attempting to die by suicide, DCP (South Division) P Krishnakant tweeted on Thursday. The DCP said that the police officers had rushed to the spot, rescued the "unconscious boy" and shifted him to a hospital. "A life was saved," he added.

34.title: Traffic diversions announced in Hyd for BJP's national executive meet
34.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police have released a traffic advisory in view of the national executive meet of BJP on July 2 and 3. While vehicles will be diverted at COD Junction, people have also been asked to avoid the Hitex and Cyber Towers Junctions. Offices located between Kavuri Hills and Kothaguda Junction have been advised to stagger work timings accordingly.

35.title: 2 buildings collapse in Mumbai's Kalbadevi, Sion; 3 such incidents in 4 days
35.article_body: A portion of a 100-year-old building in Mumbai's Kalbadevi collapsed on Thursday and no casualties were reported. Another such incident happened in Sion where a portion of ground-plus-five structures fell. The Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority was carrying out repair works at the Kalbadevi building. Notably, this takes the total number of such incidents to three in four days.

36.title: Europe to see high levels of COVID-19 this summer, warns WHO
36.article_body: The World Health Organization said it expects "high levels" of COVID-19 in Europe this summer. COVID-19 "won't go away just because countries stop looking for it. It's still spreading...changing and...taking lives", WHO Europe's Regional Director Hans Kluge said. The 53 countries in WHO's European region are now reporting nearly 5,00,000 cases daily, up from 1,50,000 at May-end, WHO data showed.

37.title: Pantaloons announces Grand Fashion Sale with upto 60% off
37.article_body: Pantaloons has announced its Grand Fashion Sale with up to 60% off on women's, men's, and kids' clothing. Customers can avail discounts by visiting the Pantaloons stores or shopping online via the Pantaloons website or app. "Don't pick just one or two styles when you can buy them all, grab the trendiest styles at your nearest store," said the brand.

38.title: Video shows Neeraj Chopra nearly breaching 90-metre mark to break his own national record
38.article_body: A video shows India's Olympic gold-medal winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra nearly breaching the 90-metre mark to break his own national record. The 24-year-old set the national record with a best throw of 89.94 metres at the Stockholm Diamond League. It was the second time in a month that Neeraj broke his own national record.

39.title: Wasim Jaffer names India playing XI for Test against England that begins today
39.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer has named his Team India playing XI for the rescheduled fifth Test against England that will begin at Edgbaston today. Jaffer named Shubman Gill and Cheteshwar Pujara as the openers. He also included both Ravindra Jadeja and Ravichandran Ashwin in the team. He named Hanuma Vihari as the number three batter.

40.title: Meta to reduce hiring, warns staff of 'serious times' in internal memo
40.article_body: CEO Mark Zuckerberg told Meta employees that it will reduce hiring engineers by at least 30% this year. He added, "This might be one of the worst downturns...we've seen in recent history". Meanwhile, Chief Product Officer Chris Cox in an internal memo to the staff also wrote, "I have to underscore that we're in serious times here and...headwinds are fierce."

41.title: 50-yr-old man smoking on 10th floor balcony slips in Gurugram, dies
41.article_body: A 50-year-old man, who was smoking on the balcony of the 10th floor of a building in Gurugram's Sector-83 on Thursday, allegedly accidentally slipped and fell to death, police said. The balcony fencing was short due to which he might have lost his balance, police added. The family members do not suspect any foul play, police further said.

42.title: Rottweiler attacks retired policeman, his dog in Pune; FIR filed
42.article_body: A case has been filed after Rottweiler attacked a retired Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) and his dog while they were out for a walk. The ACP had previously told the Rottweiler's owner that the dog breed wasn't allowed in residential areas due to their aggressive nature, according to the complaint. The Rottweiler had pounced on and bitten the ACP.

43.title: Lightning hits boat carrying 7 people in US; incident caught on camera
43.article_body: The US Coast Guard rescued seven people after the boat they were in was struck by lightning 100 miles off the coast of Florida. None of the passengers were injured in the incident, which was caught on camera. The occupants of the boat were brought back to an air station where they met their relatives, the US Coast Guard said.

44.title: 'Alien things' near border with S Korea responsible for COVID-19 outbreak: N Korea
44.article_body: North Korea on Friday claimed that the country's first COVID-19 outbreak began with people touching "alien things" near the border with South Korea. North Korea ordered people to "vigilantly deal with alien things coming by wind and other climate phenomena and balloons in the areas along the demarcation line and borders", according to state media.

45.title: Mumbai teen dies by suicide after sister throws phone in drain
45.article_body: A 17-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after her elder sister threw her mobile phone into a drain in Mumbai's Malad on Thursday, police said. The deceased was involved with a boy and her family had found out about it, an official said. The girl's elder sister scolded her and threw her phone in a drain, the official added.

46.title: Team India squads for T20I and ODI series against England announced
46.article_body: Team India squads for T20I and ODI series against England have been announced. Captain Rohit Sharma, who will miss the Test, will return for both the ODI and T20I series. Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah will join the white-ball squad from second T20I onwards. Shikhar Dhawan, Prasidh Krishna, Mohammad Shami and Mohammed Siraj have been selected just for ODI series.

47.title: Neeraj breaks his own national record again, finishes 2nd at Stockholm Diamond League
47.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra broke his own national record at the Stockholm Diamond League. The 24-year-old finished runner-up in the event with a best throw of 89.94 metres. He had set the previous national record with an 89.30-metre throw at the Paavo Nurmi Games earlier this month after breaking his own national record of 88.07-metre throw.

48.title: Uddhav congratulates CM Shinde, says 'I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra'
48.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday congratulated Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on being sworn in as new CM and Deputy CM respectively. "I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra!" Thackeray said on Twitter. Thackeray resigned as the CM on Wednesday after the Supreme Court rejected Shiv Sena's plea to stay floor test.

49.title: Mahhi accuses cook of threatening to kill her family, says 'Scared for daughter's life'
49.article_body: Actor-couple Mahhi Vij and Jay Bhanushali filed a police complaint on Thursday after their cook allegedly threatened to kill them. "He openly told me he will kill me with khanjar...Scared for my...daughter's life," she wrote in a series of now-deleted tweets. "When we went to the police station he kept calling me. I have all the recordings," Mahhi told ETimes.

50.title: Tom Hiddleston, fiancée Zawe Ashton expecting 1st child; pic shows actress' baby bump
50.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston and his fiancée, actress Zawe Ashton are expecting their first child together. Zawe, who attended the premiere of her new movie 'Mr Malcolm's List' in New York, was photographed with her baby bump for the first time. Hiddleston confirmed his engagement with the actress earlier in June.

51.title: Special Maha Assembly sessions on July 2, 3; Speaker election to be held
51.article_body: The Maharashtra Cabinet has decided to call special sessions of the Assembly on July 2 and 3. On the first day of the session, the election for Speaker will be completed as the post is vacant since Nana Patole's resignation. The decision comes after Eknath Shinde took oath as the new Chief Minister of Maharashtra.

52.title: 18-year-old girl dies of rabies a month after being bitten by dog in Kerala
52.article_body: An 18-year-old student, who was being treated for rabies, passed away on Thursday, a month after she was bitten by a dog in Kerala's Palakkad district, her relative said. The girl, who took anti-rabies injections, was reportedly taken to a private hospital after she started showing symptoms. The dog reportedly also bit its owner a day before biting her.

53.title: Punjab passes resolution against Panjab University's central status
53.article_body: Punjab Assembly has passed a resolution against giving Panjab University (PU) the status of a central university. Punjab Education Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer moved the resolution and called it a matter of identity, saying, "We will not let the central government centralise it at any cost." Only BJP MLAs Jangi Lal Mahajan and Ashwani Sharma opposed the resolution.

54.title: Time has come to say bye bye Modi: KT Rama Rao over price rise
54.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday said that it was time to say "bye bye" to PM Narendra Modi. "The gas cylinder price in India is the highest in the world. Modi brought rupee value to ₹79 (against US dollar) in 75 years of Indian independence...Now the time has come to say 'bye bye Modi'," KTR said.

55.title: Bad news for Uddhav: Omar after Eknath Shinde sworn-in as Maha CM
55.article_body: After Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah said it was bad news for Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray and his branch. "Uddhav was probably counting on a BJP CM giving him a political weapon to target Shinde with," Omar said. This makes rebuilding Shiv Sena more difficult, he added.

56.title: BJP seeks ex-ally SAD's support for Droupadi Murmu in Prez polls
56.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda reached out to Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal to secure the party's support for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu ahead of Presidential polls. Notably, SAD left the NDA alliance over the contentious farm laws, which the Centre withdrew in 2021. Presidential elections are slated to be held on July 18.

57.title: Good govt being formed: Kesarkar after Shinde becomes Maha CM
57.article_body: After Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as Maharashtra's Chief Minister, Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar said that a good government was being formed. "Two parties that believe in Hindutva and had parted ways, have come back together," Kesarkar said. "Their tallest leaders...had no reservation about having a Deputy CM from their side," he added.

58.title: UAPA necessary to act against terrorists beheading people: Minister
58.article_body: Laws like the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) are "necessary" so that action can be taken against terrorists and those "who behead other people," Union Minister RK Singh said on Thursday. He said that UAPA is to "ensure that people are not killed", and "those who do not listen to diktats of terrorists are not wiped out".

59.title: PM Modi to unveil Alluri Seetarama Raju's statue in Andhra on July 4
59.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Andhra Pradesh's Bhimavaram town on July 4 to unveil the statue of freedom fighter Alluri Seetarama Raju as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations. Special Chief Secretary Rajat Bhargava on Thursday inspected the arrangements ahead of the event. PM Modi will unveil a 30-foot bronze statue in Bhimavaram Park and address the gathering.

60.title: B'luru's Kempegowda Int'l Airport crosses 250-million passenger mark
60.article_body: The Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru has crossed the 250-million passenger mark in its 15th year of establishment, Bangalore International Airport Ltd (BIAL) stated. The airport has also handled two million air traffic movements since its opening in 2008. BIAL said an additional 50 million passengers travelled from the airport in a span of nearly three years despite the pandemic.

61.title: Raj CM holds meeting over law & order situation after Udaipur killing
61.article_body: After meeting the family members of Kanhaiya Lal, who was murdered by two men on June 28 in Udaipur, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot held a meeting with officials over the law and order situation in the state. "Our police did a good job, arrested the accused and found international links...We'll appeal to take this case via fast track," Gehlot said.

62.title: 6 smugglers arrested, 670 gm heroin worth ₹1cr seized in Meghalaya
62.article_body: Six people were arrested in an operation against drug trafficking in Meghalaya and over 670 gm of heroin worth nearly ₹1 crore was seized, a top police officer said on Thursday. Police set up checkpoints in East Jaintia Hills district and arrested two persons, DGP LR Bishnoi said. After their preliminary interrogation, four more persons were arrested, he added.

63.title: 5 arrested in gangrape of woman, 6-yr-old daughter in Uttarakhand
63.article_body: Police on Thursday said they arrested five suspects in sexual assault and gangrape of a six-year-old girl and her mother in Uttarakhand's Haridwar. The girl and her mother were first sexually assaulted by a Haridwar resident who offered them a lift on his motorbike, and were again gangraped by four other accused who hailed from Uttar Pradesh, an official said.

64.title: June monsoon rains in India 8% below average: IMD
64.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the country has received 8% lesser rainfall than average in June. The IMD has attributed this to 54% lower rainfall as compared to normal in central India. Even though monsoons arrived on the coast of Kerala on May 29, its progress was stalled for over one week.

65.title: NATO declares China a 'security threat' for 1st time: Reports
65.article_body: NATO has listed China as a "security threat" for the first time, stating that the country's ambitions and its "coercive policies" challenge the bloc's "interests, security and values", reports stated. "China is substantially building up its military forces, including nuclear weapons, bullying its neighbours [and] threatening Taiwan," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said at the bloc's summit in Madrid.

66.title: 5 protesters killed by security forces during protests: Reports
66.article_body: Five protesters were shot dead by security forces in Sudan on Thursday as thousands protested against the country's military leadership, reports citing a medical group said. Security forces also fired tear gas and water cannon on some of the protesters. Last October, the military led by General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan had toppled Sudan's transitional government.

67.title: EU, New Zealand strike free trade deal after 4 years of talks
67.article_body: After about four years of talks, New Zealand and the European Union (EU) on Thursday announced that they've concluded negotiations on a free trade agreement (FTA). "Trade between us should increase by 30%," European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen tweeted. "We managed to ensure a level playing field for EU investors in New Zealand and vice versa," she said.

68.title: Qatar donates $60 million to Lebanon's army amid economic crisis
68.article_body: Qatar has donated $60 million to Lebanon's army amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Since the crisis erupted in 2019, the Lebanese pound has lost over 90% of its value and tens of thousands have become jobless. Last year, Qatar had announced that it would support the army with 70 tons of food every month for a year.

69.title: Russia open to dialogue on nuclear non-proliferation: Putin
69.article_body: Russia is open to dialogue on strategic stability and nuclear non-proliferation, Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday. However, there aren't any plans for strategic talks between Russia and the US, a Russian government spokesman said. Despite the Russian invasion of Ukraine, both Russia and the US have stressed the importance of maintaining communication on the issue of nuclear arms.

70.title: John Visentin, CEO of printer maker Xerox, passes away aged 59
70.article_body: Printer maker Xerox Holdings Corporation's CEO John Visentin passed away due to complications from a long illness, the company said. "The Xerox family is profoundly saddened by this untimely event and extends its heartfelt condolences to John's wife, his five daughters and his family," the company added. The company has named President and Chief Operating Officer Steve Bandrowczak Interim CEO.

71.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75%, biggest increase since 1994
71.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its key interest rate by 0.75%, marking the biggest rate hike made by the US central bank since 1994. "The committee is strongly committed to returning inflation to its 2% objective," the bank's policy-setting committee said. The move will raise US Fed's benchmark short-term rate to a range of 1.5% to 1.75%.

72.title: Not a hiatus, BTS will work as group while focusing on solo careers: BTS' label
72.article_body: The group's label HYBE clarified that BTS isn't going on a 'hiatus' and will work together as a group. "BTS isn't taking a hiatus. Members will be focusing more on solo projects at this time," read a statement from HYBE. This came after BTS, in a video, explained to fans that they need the time to take an extended break.

73.title: Mobile phones, SIM cards, cigarettes seized from 2 Punjab jails
73.article_body: Police said that 14 mobile phones and other prohibited items were recovered during search operations at Punjab's Goindwal Sahib and Amritsar central jails. After the recoveries, seven persons were booked in four separate cases. Apart from mobile phones, two SIM cards, six springs of heaters, 114 bundles of cigarettes and 79 packets of tobacco were recovered during the search operations.

74.title: BJP's countdown has begun: Cong over Rahul Gandhi's ED summons
74.article_body: As protests continue over the Enforcement Directorate's investigation against Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Nana Patole said, "The countdown has begun for the BJP government." The probe against Rahul Gandhi is being carried out "at the behest of the Central government", he added. "Now, the Delhi Police in tandem with the BJP has carried out atrocities on Congress leaders," Patole said.

75.title: India test fires Prithvi, 2nd nuclear-capable missile in 10 days
75.article_body: India carried out another test of its other nuclear-capable missile, Prithvi, nearly 10 days after the routine test of Agni was carried out. "The missile is a proven system and is capable of striking targets with very high precision," an official statement said, adding that the "user training launch successfully validated all operational and technical parameters of the missile".

76.title: Suriya to do a cameo in Akshay's Soorarai Pottru remake, shares post
76.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Suriya on Wednesday shot for the Hindi remake of his film 'Soorarai Pottru'. He will make a cameo appearance in the movie, which is headlined by actor Akshay Kumar. Taking to Twitter, Suriya wrote, "Akshay sir to see you as #VIR was nostalgic! @Sudha_Kongara can see our story beautifully coming alive again...Enjoyed every minute with the team."

77.title: EU signs gas deal with Egypt & Israel to reduce dependency on Russia
77.article_body: European Union (EU) signed a deal with Egypt and Israel to increase liquified natural gas (LNG) sales to EU countries on Wednesday in Cairo. The deal aims to reduce dependency on Russian oil amid Ukraine war. As per deal, Israel will send gas to EU countries via Egypt, which will liquify it for exports via sea, European Commission chief said.

78.title: CET exam centres to be camera-monitored to curb cheating in K'taka
78.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said that students taking the Common Entrance Test (CET) in the state will be monitored by video cameras to limit possible fraud and other malpractices. CET exams are taken by students who wish to enrol in engineering, agriculture, veterinary and pharmaceutical courses. The examination will be held from June 16 to 18.

79.title: Kamla Nagar market will soon be known as pride of Delhi: Sisodia
79.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia inspected Delhi's Kamla Nagar market on Wednesday and said that it will soon be known as the "pride of Delhi". Kamla Nagar market is among the five key markets picked by the city government for redevelopment under its "Rozgar Budget", which aims to generate 20 lakh job opportunities in five years.

80.title: South filmmakers and writers have tremendous talent: Varun Dhawan
80.article_body: Varun Dhawan said south filmmakers and writers have tremendous talent. "SS Rajamouli sir is [at] top of the list. Then there are...many like Surender Reddy is great, the director who made F3 (Anil Ravipudi) he's got great comedy. The director of Pushpa (Sukumar) is amazing," he added. "There was a film which I...loved...It's a Malayalam film called, 'Premam'," Varun said.

81.title: Not having a partner is deepest regret of my life, it's too late now: Karan
81.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he feels it's too late for him to find a life partner. "I think what a life partner does for you, a parent [or] a child, can never fulfil that," he added. "That's reserved for...your life partner [and] I don't have that. That's a vacant spot in my life and that's my deepest regret," Karan said.

82.title: Yogi govt to now use helicopters to check violence, riots in UP
82.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led UP government will now use helicopters to check mob violence, riots and arson in public places. UP government has sought proposals from Airbus Helicopters regarding the use of helicopters in tourism, policing, emergency medical services and law enforcement. The helicopters can also be used for rescue work and for fighting floods, said an Airbus representative.

83.title: 14-yr-old UP girl, mother die in sleep after table fan falls on them
83.article_body: Police said that a 35-year-old woman and her 14-year-old daughter died of electrocution in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj on Wednesday. The incident took place when they were sleeping in their house and a table fan fell on them. The two were electrocuted when they touched a bare wire while trying to move the fan, Maharajganj SP Dr Kaustubh said.

84.title: Will keep backing Russia on sovereignty: China's Xi tells Putin
84.article_body: Chinese President told his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin during a phone conversation on Wednesday that Beijing will keep backing Moscow on sovereignty and security issues. Xi reportedly praised the "good momentum of development" in bilateral ties. Notably, Russia and China opened a new cross-border bridge on June 10 to boost trade amid Western sanctions against Russia for Ukraine war.

85.title: 20-yr-old takes pics, videos of women in Mumbai society; arrested
85.article_body: A 20-year-old man, Sarthak Borade, was arrested by the police for allegedly taking photos and videos of several women in Mumbai's Grant Road area. Police said that a woman, who was noticing his behaviour since last year, confronted him and lodged a police complaint. "We have...recovered the photos and videos from his phone," a police officer said.

86.title: 2 people, including a 9-yr-old, drown in a pond in UP's Bhadohi
86.article_body: Police said that two people, including a minor, drowned in a pond while bathing in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi. The deceased have been identified as 19-year-old Sahil Ansari and nine-year-old Vishnu Valmiki. Ansari was bathing in a pond in Kunwarganj village when he began drowning and Valmiki tried to save him but he too drowned, Gyanpur police station SHO said.

87.title: This girl is famous, I'm obsessed: H'wood fashion designer on Uorfi's styling
87.article_body: Hollywood fashion designer, Harris Reed, praised model-actress Uorfi Javed's styling, as according to him she re-created a look from one of his collections. Taking to Instagram, Harris shared a reel and wrote, "This girl is clearly very famous who remade one of my show looks and has 45 million views. It is very obsessive and I'm really obsessed."

88.title: Which are the world's most expensive cities to live in?
88.article_body: Shanghai has topped the list of the world's most expensive cities to live in, as per Julius Baer Group's 2022 global wealth and lifestyle report. London, the capital of the United Kingdom, has been ranked second. Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, is at number three in the list, while Hong Kong and Singapore have been ranked fourth and fifth.

89.title: Beijing revokes licence of bar linked to latest COVID-19 outbreak
89.article_body: Beijing has revoked the licence of a 24-hour bar that is believed to be at the centre of a cluster of over 320 COVID-19 cases across several districts. A criminal case has been filed against the bar's owner for "breaching the law and conducting dishonest acts". Over 2,000 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Beijing since late April.

90.title: Rocketry script was torn into shreds, took me 1.5 yrs to rework it: Madhavan
90.article_body: R Madhavan, who made his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', revealed that he had to redo his entire script after he spoke to the subject of his film, Nambi Narayanan. The actor-director said after that conversation, he could see his "script being torn to shreds" and it took him "another one and a half years to rework it".

91.title: Crypto market value falls below $900 bn as Bitcoin drops to $20,000 level
91.article_body: The value of the global crypto market fell to under $900 billion on Wednesday from a peak of $2.97 trillion in November 2020. Bitcoin, the world's largest crypto by market capitalisation, also fell 7.8% to $20,289, its lowest value since December 2020. Bitcoin has dropped around 30% in value since Friday and lost over half of its value this year.

92.title: Tripura Cong locks ED office in protest against summons to Rahul
92.article_body: The Tripura unit of Congress on Wednesday locked the local ED office in protest against the interrogation of party leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman said the summons is a means to harass Gandhi, adding that PM Narendra Modi has "nothing to show people".

93.title: Delhi Police tore my clothes, removed my shoes during protest: Cong's Jothimani
93.article_body: Congress MP Jothimani has alleged that Delhi Police personnel assaulted her and tore her clothes while she was protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. Sharing a video online, she alleged, "They removed my shoes and carried me like a criminal." Jothimani added, "There are eight women on this bus and we repeatedly asked for water but they refused."

94.title: Sri Lanka to reserve fuel for cremations amid economic crisis
94.article_body: Sri Lanka has proposed to reserve a portion of fuel for cremation purposes, in accordance with Buddhist customs, amid shortage of fuel and other essentials in the country due to economic crisis. "We will supply [fuel to] bulk users that [are] hotels, hospitals and crematoriums," PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said. Sri Lanka will introduce a fuel rationing scheme from July onwards.

95.title: Rahul Gandhi questioned by ED for 3rd day, summoned again on Friday
95.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning on Friday in connection with the National Herald case. Rahul appeared before the Enforcement Directorate for the third consecutive day on Wednesday. He arrived at the ED Headquarters in Delhi at around 11.35 am on Wednesday.

96.title: Anil Kapoor remembers his mother, says 'She used to make clothes for me'
96.article_body: During a contestant's performance on 'Superstar Singer 2', Anil Kapoor remembered his relationship with his mother. "Mani and his mother have taken me back to my childhood. They've made me recall the machine (sewing machine) we used to own," he added. "The way you've made this shirt for him, my mother also used to make clothes for me," Anil said.

97.title: Hardik Pandya named captain as India squad for T20I series against Ireland announced
97.article_body: The All-India Senior Selection Committee on Wednesday announced a 17-member Team India squad for the two-match T20I series against Ireland. Hardik Pandya has been named captain of the squad, with several senior members of the squad being rested. Sanju Samson and Suryakumar Yadav have also been included in the squad. Meanwhile, Rahul Tripathi has received his maiden Team India call-up.

98.title: Groom dances, takes selfies in moving open roof Audi in UP; fined ₹2 lakh
98.article_body: A video of a groom dancing and taking selfies in a moving open roof Audi amid heavy traffic during a wedding procession in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar went viral online. The video showed his friends accompanying him in Audi and other cars and hanging out of windows and sun roofs of their cars. Muzaffarnagar Police said they've fined nine vehicles ₹2,02,000.

99.title: Nomination process for July 18 Presidential election begins
99.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Wednesday issued a gazette notification for the 16th Presidential election. With this, the process to file nominations for the July 18 election has begun. The nominations can be filed till June 29 and the scrutiny of the papers will be held on June 30, while the votes will be counted on July 21.

100.title: Will reduce effectiveness of armed forces: Rahul on 'Agnipath' scheme
100.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday reacted to the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', stating that it will reduce the 'operational effectiveness of the armed forces'. "The BJP government must stop compromising the dignity, traditions, valour and discipline of our forces," he tweeted. 'Agnipath' proposes to employ aspirants (below officer rank) in the military for four years.

101.title: PURE EV scooter catches fire while charging in Gujarat; video surfaces
101.article_body: A PURE EV scooter caught fire while it was plugged in for charging in Gujarat's Patan. A video showing the e-scooter on fire outside a house also surfaced on social media. Last month, a PURE EV scooter caught fire in Hyderabad after stopping suddenly. The startup had recalled 2,000 e-scooters in April this year after incidents of fire were reported.

102.title: Won't give up on my hope of working with Kajol: Kichcha post his Twitter debate
102.article_body: Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeepa said he hopes that his recent Hindi vs South debate with Ajay Devgn does not affect his dream of working with the actor's wife and actress Kajol. "I had this great dream of working with Kajol ma'am...[it]...fell flat with this debate," he added. "I'll never give up on my hope of working with Kajol," Kichcha said.

103.title: High Court judge's daughter arrested for murder of shooter Sippy Sidhu in Chandigarh
103.article_body: Kalyani Singh, a Himachal Pradesh High Court judge Justice's daughter, has been arrested over the murder of national-level shooter and lawyer Sippy Sidhu in Chandigarh in 2015. "There was a delay in the arrest but I still believe in law," said Sippy's mother. She told the police that Kalyani called Sippy to a park on the day he was killed.

104.title: Russia's territorial ambitions are from Warsaw to Sofia: Ukraine Prez
104.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Wednesday that Russia's territorial ambitions aren't limited to Ukrainian cities but rather stretch to capital cities of Poland and Bulgaria, Warsaw and Sofia. He made these remarks while virtually addressing Czech Republic's parliament, seeking additional sanctions by EU against Russia. EU has adopted six rounds of sanctions against Russia so far.

105.title: Singer B Praak's baby passes away at the time of birth
105.article_body: Singer B Praak on Wednesday shared that his baby passed away at the time of birth. "It's the most painful phase we are going through as parents. We would like to thank all the doctors and the staff for their endless efforts," he said. The singer and his wife Meera Bachan announced in April they were expecting their second child.

106.title: Surat Cong, villagers complain about water pollution by textile mills
106.article_body: Congress leaders along with residents of Parab village in Surat complained to district collector and Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB) officials about untreated waste being discharged from textile mills into Kadodara creek in Kamrej. "The industrial units have violated pollution norms," Darshan Naik, former LoP in Surat district panchayat said. Parab village has a population of 2,000 people.

107.title: Pics show Varun, Kiara eating inside Mumbai metro; people ask 'Is it allowed?'
107.article_body: Anil Kapoor, Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani took a ride in the Mumbai metro on Tuesday amid promotions of 'Jug Jugg Jeeyo'. After visuals of Varun and Kiara eating inside the metro surfaced, an Instagram user commented, "Is eating allowed inside the Metro?" while another comment read, "Are rules meant only for common people?"

108.title: Forest fire destroys rare chilgoza trees in Himachal's Kinnaur
108.article_body: The forest fire in the high-altitude Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh raging since the past few days has been brought under control, but has destroyed hundreds of rare chilgoza pine and juniper trees. "The fire affected 2,000 bighas," Kinnaur Deputy Commissioner said. The chilgoza pine nuts, consumed locally and sold abroad, are a source of livelihood for Jangi village residents.

109.title: Bad sign for healthy democracy: Cong's Pilot after being detained
109.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot, after being detained for trying to enter the party office, said that his detention was a bad sign for a healthy democracy. "I don't know what next they plan to do with us. This sort of detainment has never happened before. This behaviour in a civil society is just not done," he said.

110.title: This is cute, I had no idea: PhonePe CEO on reports of company filing for IPO
110.article_body: Hours after reports came out that PhonePe is considering raising funds through an initial public offering (IPO), its Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam said he had no idea about it. "This is cute. I had no idea my own company is filing an IPO," he wrote. Reports said the company is seeking a valuation of $8-10 billion.

111.title: Supreme Court to hear plea against demolitions by UP govt tomorrow
111.article_body: Supreme Court will on Thursday hear a petition seeking directions to the Uttar Pradesh government to follow rules while carrying out demolitions in the state. The petition was filed by Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind. It sought due notice and opportunity of hearing to each of the affected persons. This comes days after authorities demolished the house of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed.

112.title: Thought dad died in Ghulam, I started howling: Deepak Tijori's daughter
112.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori's daughter Samara Tijori spoke about the time when she thought her father died after she watched a scene featuring him in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Ghulam'. Samara said, "I was 5-6. I saw that train sequence, and that's a...well-cut sequence, you actually feel someone's hurt." "I saw...and I thought my dad died. I started crying and howling," she added.

113.title: Police use water cannons on BJP workers protesting against Kerala CM
113.article_body: Kerala Police used water cannons and tear gas to stop BJP Yuva Morcha members as they protested against CM Pinarayi Vijayan, demanding his resignation over the gold smuggling case. The BJP workers staged a protest outside the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. The protests came after the prime accused in the gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM's involvement in the scam.

114.title: Sharad Pawar refuses to contest for Presidential post
114.article_body:
NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday refused to contest for the upcoming Presidential election. 
"I sincerely appreciate the leaders of opposition parties for suggesting my name as a candidate for the election of the President of India, at the meeting held in Delhi. However I like to state that I have humbly declined the proposal of my candidature," Pawar said.

115.title: Mumbai sees 33% rise in daily COVID-19 cases to 2,293, highest since Jan 23
115.article_body: Mumbai reported 2,293 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 23 this year. This is a 33% rise in COVID-19 cases from Tuesday's 1,724 cases. The city also reported one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 13.37% and the number of active cases rose to 12,341.

116.title: Production of fuel more than sufficient to take care of demand surge, clarifies govt
116.article_body: Dismissing rumours of a shortage, government clarified that production of petrol and diesel in India is more than sufficient to take care of any demand surge. "This unprecedented growth has created some temporary logistics issues at local level. Oil Companies have geared up to tackle these issues by increasing...stocks," said government. This follows reports of fuel shortages in various states.

117.title: Panvel civic body issues notice to remove illegal hoardings: Report
117.article_body: The Panvel civic body has issued a notice to remove all unauthorised banners, posters, flex boards or hoardings across the city, reports said. The civic body warned of stern action if the banners are not taken down. It has also asked political parties and citizens to take permission before putting up hoardings in public places or on building rooftops.

118.title: Appoint nodal officers to check waterlogging issues in Pune: BJP
118.article_body: BJP leaders have asked the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to appoint nodal officers to review the waterlogging situation in the city as part of the administration's pre-monsoon arrangements. "The civic body needs to...do traffic management to avoid chaos during the monsoon," BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar said. PMC earlier claimed that it had cleared 76 waterlogging-prone spots in the city.

119.title: Sales tax official caught while accepting ₹20 lakh bribe in Thane
119.article_body: An Assistant Commissioner of sales tax department from Thane was arrested by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) for accepting a bribe of ₹20 lakh from a hotelier. The accused has been identified as 42-year-old Dhananjay Janardhan Shirshat. "The complainant...told us that Dhananjay...demanded ₹30 lakh for the past assessment and for getting new GST number for his hotel," an ACB official said.

120.title: BESCOM to add 140 EV chargers in the next 6 months in Bengaluru
120.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has said it will add 140 EV chargers in the next six months in order to strengthen the electric vehicles' charging network. BESCOM MD P Rajendra Cholan said that tenders have been invited to set up 1,000 EV charging stations across Karnataka. "Currently, BESCOM is operating 136 EV chargers in Bengaluru city," Cholan added.

121.title: Delhi sees a 23% jump in new COVID cases to 1,375; positivity rate rises to 7.01%
121.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,375 new COVID-19 cases, a rise of 23% from 1,118 cases recorded the previous day. The city's COVID-19 positivity rate rose to 7.01% from Tuesday's 6.5%. Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 3,643, as per a health bulletin.

122.title: Sonu Sood helps Indian man stuck in Thailand, says 'Had to bring you back'
122.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood rescued a man stuck in Thailand. Recently, a person named Sahil Khan took to Twitter seeking the actor's help. Replying to him, Sood stated that he'll send the tickets. On June 13, Sahil tweeted, "Finally reached India...true gem @SonuSood." Sood retweeted the post and wrote, "You're my Indian brother, had to bring you back."

123.title: Gujarat woman stabs husband to death to save son from being thrashed
123.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly stabbing her 45-year-old husband to death in order to stop him from beating their son. The woman, a resident of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, used a kitchen knife to attack her husband on Monday night. The deceased was going to thrash his son as he wasn't able to access a few TV channels.

124.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as per Hurun list?
124.article_body: Reliance Industries with a value of ₹18,87,881 crore is India's most valuable company, according to Burgundy Private Hurun India 500- Special Report. It's followed by Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, Adani Green Energy, Bharti Airtel, Housing Development Finance Corporation, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. The total value of these companies is ₹71.8 lakh crore.

125.title: Sidharth Malhotra goes on a bike ride with Sadhguru, shares pics
125.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Sidharth Malhotra shared few pictures of a bike ride with Sadhguru for 'Save Soil Movement'. In one picture, Sidharth and Sadhguru could be seen sitting on bikes and posing for the camera. In the photos, Sidharth is seen wearing a white T-shirt, while Sadhguru donned a yellow t-shirt with Save Our Soil written on it.

126.title: PM Modi to visit his mother in Guj on her 100th birthday on June 18
126.article_body: PM Modi is likely to visit Gujarat on June 18 to visit his mother, who will be turning 100 that day. A celebration has also been organised at the Modi's native town of Vadnagar in the Mehsana district by Hiraba's (PM's mother) sons in the evening. "Hiraba's presence at the event will depend on her health," said Prahlad Modi.

127.title: Bihar woman constable thrown off moving train while resisting thieves
127.article_body: A woman constable of Bihar Police was on Wednesday thrown off a moving train while she was resisting a theft bid in the state's Katihar district. "Around four miscreants tried to snatch my purse and mobile phone and when I resisted their bid, they pushed me off," the injured constable said in the hospital.

128.title: Ambala tourist, instructor killed as paraglider crashes in Himachal
128.article_body: A tourist from Ambala and a paragliding instructor were killed after their paraglider collided with a hill soon after take-off in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The incident took place in the Dobhi area of the district. Post-mortem is being done in a nearby hospital, Kullu Superintendent of Police (SP) Gurdev Chand Sharma said.

129.title: The Fuel Delivery to soon offer doorstep delivery of CNG in Mumbai
129.article_body: Energy distribution startup The Fuel Delivery will soon begin doorstep delivery of CNG to customers in Mumbai. The service, which will start from places like Sion and Mahape initially, will be extended across the city soon. The startup has signed a Letter of Intent with Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) for the round-the-clock service which will begin in next three months.

130.title: Prayagraj police to put up posters of violence accused on roadsides
130.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj will put up posters of people allegedly involved in the June 10 violence on roadsides and in public places to identify them, officials said. Police will also circulate these posters on social media platforms and their houses will also be attached. The violence broke out after Friday prayers over remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

131.title: Fire breaks out at commercial building in Pune, no casualties reported
131.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Pune's Shivajinagar area on Wednesday morning. No casualties were reported due to the fire, which damaged a set of documents of an automobile sales company. Officials suspect that a short circuit in the electrical system in basement could have led to the blaze.

132.title: WHO explores reports of monkeypox virus in semen
132.article_body: The WHO is looking into reports that the monkeypox virus is present in the semen of patients, to check the possibility that the disease could be sexually transmitted, WHO's Catherine Smallwood said. "This may have been something that we were unaware of in this disease before," she said, adding that most frequent mode of transmission is associated with skin-to-skin contact.

133.title: DOGE founder shares 'death knocking' meme to suggest real estate crash, Musk says 'True'
133.article_body: Dogecoin Co-founder Billy Markus has suggested that real estate may be the next thing to collapse after stock and crypto markets. He posted a meme with death opening doors in turn and leaving pools of blood behind each of them. Tesla CEO and the world's richest man Elon Musk replied to the tweet by writing, "True."

134.title: 2.4 mn hectares of winter crops won't be harvested due to war: Ukraine
134.article_body: Ukraine's Agriculture Ministry said around 2.4 million hectares of winter crops with a total value of $1.435 billion will remain unharvested in the country because of Russia's invasion. So far, the agriculture sector has suffered losses of $4.292 billion because of the invasion, it added. Some 92,000 cows and 258,000 pigs have been killed in areas affected by fighting.

135.title: Musk-owned SpaceX's Starship will be ready for orgital flight in July
135.article_body: SpaceX's Starship vehicle will be ready for orbital flight next month, said Founder and CEO Elon Musk in a tweet on Tuesday. "I was in the high bay and mega bay late last night reviewing progress," Musk said in response to a query regarding Starship's orbital flight. "We'll have a second Starship stack ready to fly in August," Musk added.

136.title: Aaditya Thackeray, Shiv Sena leaders perform aarti in Ayodhya's ISKCON Temple
136.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray, along with other Shiv Sena leaders, performed aarti at ISKCON Temple in Ayodhya's Ramnagar on Wednesday. "Recalling the relationship between Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray and ISKCON Mumbai," Thackeray tweeted while sharing a video of the aarti. "I am grateful for the invitation and love to visit ISKCON Ramnagar," his tweet further read.

137.title: Ryanair drops Afrikaans nationality test for S Africans amid backlash
137.article_body: Ryanair has dropped a requirement for South African passengers to prove their nationality by taking a test in Afrikaans language. This comes after the move, which was aimed at weeding out fraudulent South African passports, received backlash from the country's government. Afrikaans is spoken by around 12% of South African population and was linked to apartheid era in the country.

138.title: Opposition parties adopt resolution to field common candidate for Presidential election
138.article_body: The leaders of several Opposition parties on Wednesday adopted a resolution to field common candidate for the upcoming Presidential election, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said. "This is a good beginning. We sat together after several months, and we will do it again," she added. The parties included Congress, Shiv Sena, NCP, SP, PDP, National Conference, RJD and DMK among others.

139.title: Aamir to host reunion party for the team as Lagaan completes 21 yrs: Reports
139.article_body: Aamir Khan will reportedly host a reunion party at his home as Lagaan completed 21 years. To celebrate the legacy of the film, the cast will reunite at Aamir's residence today. Last year, the team had a virtual reunion to celebrate 20 years of the film. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Aamir will be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

140.title: I've aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me: Chahal
140.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, on being asked about his subdued wicket celebrations by opener Ruturaj Gaikwad, jokingly said, "Now that I have aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me." He added, "It's just a normal celebration...There are friends who are batting at the other end." Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the third South Africa T20I.

141.title: France captures senior Islamic State member in Mali
141.article_body: French troops in Mali have captured a senior member of the Islamic State militant group, French Armed Forces Ministry said. Oumeya Albakaye was captured on the intervening night of June 11-12 close to the border between Mali and Niger, it added. This comes as France prepares to complete its withdrawal from Mali, where it has been fighting ISIS since 2013.

142.title: Gangsters were born under previous govts in Punjab: AAP's Kejriwal
142.article_body: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday backed current law and order situation in Punjab while speaking at an event in Jalandhar. "I ask...Opposition, has [Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann] brought gangsters with him? These gangsters were born under...previous governments," he said. Kejriwal's comments come amid Opposition's uproar over rising crimes in Punjab following Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

143.title: 25-yr-old IAF officer kills self at hostel in Madhya Pradesh
143.article_body: A 25-year-old Indian Air Force (IAF) officer allegedly died by suicide by hanging from a ceiling fan in his hostel room in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior city on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Jaidutt Singh, was a flying officer posted in the engineering branch at Maharajpura Air Base in the city. Singh was transferred to Gwalior this year, an official said.

144.title: NZ's Kyle Jamieson ruled out of third England Test with back injury
144.article_body: New Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson has been ruled out of the third Test against England due to a back injury he picked during the second Test. "Jamieson will return home after an MRI scan revealed a stress-reaction to his lower left-back," said New Zealand's cricket board. Jamieson didn't bowl during England's second innings on Day 5 of the second Test.

145.title: BJP expels Rajasthan MLA for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
145.article_body: BJP on Tuesday expelled MLA Shobharani Kushwah from Rajasthan's Dholpur constituency for cross-voting in the recently-held Rajya Sabha elections. Kushwah was earlier suspended and served a show-cause notice for going against party orders. Notably, the BJP had asked its members to vote for independent candidate Subhash Chandra. However, Kushwah voted for Congress' Pramod Tiwari in the elections.

146.title: Woman, minor sons die after jumping in front of moving train in Delhi
146.article_body: A woman and her minor sons died after they allegedly jumped in front of a moving train in Delhi. Reports said that the incident took place at the Holambi Kalan railway station on Tuesday. The identity of the deceased is yet to be revealed. Reports also said that the police have taken possession of the bodies.

147.title: UP man impersonates Assam Crime Branch official, extorts money from suspects
147.article_body: Assam Police arrested a man from Guwahati’s Beltola area on the charges of impersonating a crime branch inspector to extort money from suspects in criminal cases. The accused, who is from UP, received money from suspects on the promise of influencing the probe and getting them exonerated, SP, Assam CID, Pranab Jyoti Goswami, said.

148.title: Haryana board declares Class 12 results, top 3 ranks secured by girls
148.article_body: The Board of School Education Haryana announced Class 12 results on Wednesday. KCM Senior Secondary School Rohtak's Kajal topped the exam by securing 498 out of 500 marks and the second and third ranks were also bagged by girls. As many as 87.08% of the students cleared the exam. Girls' pass percentage was 90.51%, while it was 83.96% for boys.

149.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters out, India's Ishan Kishan jumps 68 spots
149.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the latest rankings for T20I batters. India's Ishan Kishan jumped 68 spots to break into the top 10. He is now ranked seventh with 689 rating points and is the only Indian batter in the top 10. Further, Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan jumped a spot to be ranked second with 794 rating points.

150.title: Quit acting after my debut film which was a super-duper hit: Suchitra
150.article_body: Discussing her decision to quit acting for a few years, actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi said, "I quit after my debut film ['Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa' which starred Shah Rukh Khan and]...was a super-duper hit." Suchitra added her parents and ex-husband, director Shekhar Kapur who directed the original 'Mr India' didn't want her to act which is why she gave up acting.

151.title: Cong's Sachin Pilot detained amid protests over Rahul’s questioning by ED
151.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot was detained on his way to Congress headquarters on Wednesday amid protests over Rahul Gandhi’s questioning by the ED. Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today in connection with the National Herald case. Earlier today, Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were detained by the police outside the AICC office.

152.title: 60-yr-old arrested for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyd
152.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a 60-year-old man on Tuesday night for allegedly misbehaving with a minor girl. According to the police officer, the accused runs a general store and touched the minor inappropriately when she had gone to purchase some products. The girl, who was in a state of shock, informed her parents, following which a case was registered.

153.title: Photographer recreates pic of Arctic region after 104 years to show melting glacier
153.article_body: Photographer Neill Drake has recreated a 1918 photo of Blomstrandbreen Glacier in the Arctic region to show how much of it has melted. "I knew that the message that this photo represented meant a whole lot more than just how accurate the boat position and mountain peaks were," he said. He added the photo was meant to make people uncomfortable.

154.title: How will BCCI distribute ₹48,390-crore fetched from IPL media rights?
154.article_body: BCCI will distribute half of ₹48,390-crore fetched from IPL media rights between the eight original franchises. The remaining half will be shared with players and state associations. As per a report, 26% of the remaining half will be distributed among domestic and international players, while 4% has been earmarked for staff salaries and the state associations will get remaining 70%.

155.title: Dad jokes about me marrying Telugu guy, don't think I'll wed soon: Sai Pallavi
155.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi said that her father jokes about her marrying a Telugu guy. Talking about her marriage plans, she said, "I've got so used to speaking Telugu at home." "I don't think it'll happen anytime soon. Right now, I'm happy being alone and I'm trying to know about myself more. I'm on that journey," she added.

156.title: Ruthless suppression of Cong's protests is blot on our democracy: Tharoor
156.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said the "ruthless" suppression of the Congress party’s protests is a "blot" on our democracy. His statement came as Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today. Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were also detained by the police outside the AICC office earlier today.

157.title: PM Modi to address public meeting in Hyderabad on July 3
157.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address a public meeting in Hyderabad on July 3 after the culmination of the BJP's national executive meeting in the city. Initially, it was proposed that PM Modi would take up a roadshow in the city. The BJP's national executive meeting will be held on July 2 and 3.

158.title: Kangana's 'Dhaakad', made at ₹85 crore budget, earns only ₹2.58 crore: Report
158.article_body: Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn a lifetime collection of ₹2.58 crore at the box office in India, as per Bollywood Hungama. The report added that the producers are facing ₹78 crore loss. It said that the producers will have to now sell satellite and digital rights at throwaway prices.

159.title: Anupam Kher posts video of travelling on Purvanchal Expressway, says 'Like US highways'
159.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher on Wednesday shared a video of his travel on the Purvanchal Expressway on his way from Lucknow to Varanasi on Twitter. He wrote, "Travelling on Purvanchal Express inaugurated recently by PM Narendra Modi is like any European or American freeways/highways. Makes me feel so proud." He added, "Kudos to Nitin Gadkari ji, Yogi Adityanath and entire team."

160.title: Natalie's character not at most exciting version in previous Thor films: Taika
160.article_body: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' director Taika Waititi, speaking about Natalie Portman's character in previous 'Thor' films, said, "It's...not the most exciting version of the female character that we want from these films." He added he talked to Natalie about changing her character in 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. He said he wanted to make her character adventurous and fun.

161.title: 4, including 2 minors, killed after SUV collides with tanker in UP
161.article_body: Four people, including two minors, were killed and two others sustained injuries when an SUV collided with a tanker on Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district. The incident took place on Tuesday night when the car was on its way to Lucknow from Ballia, police said. Injured persons have been admitted to a hospital for treatment, an official said.

162.title: Thailand opposition parties file no-confidence motion against PM
162.article_body: Thailand's opposition parties filed a no-confidence motion against PM Prayut Chan-o-cha and 10 cabinet ministers. They have accused the leaders of corruption, economic mismanagement and undermining democracy. "[Prayut] is a leader that has a flawed thinking, likes to cling to power, does not respect the rule of law, lacks morals and failed in managing state affairs," said an opposition leader.

163.title: Joe Root becomes world number one Test batter, 2 Indians in top 10
163.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters, with Joe Root reclaiming the top spot. Root is now on top of the rankings with 897 rating points. He overtook Marnus Labuschagne, who has 892 rating points. Eighth-ranked Rohit Sharma and 10th-ranked Virat Kohli are the two Indians in top 10.

164.title: Akshay Kumar is very passionate about 'Oh My God 2': Yami Gautam
164.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, speaking about working with Akshay Kumar in 'Oh My God 2', has said, "He's a very good producer also...someone who is very passionate about this film." "When I was given the narration, I could feel that he really wants to make it with the right team," she added. Yami also called Pankaj Tripathi a "fantastic actor".

165.title: BJP govt making armed forces its laboratory for experiments: Priyanka
165.article_body: A day after the Union government announced the 'Agnipath' scheme for recruitment to the armed forces, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the BJP was making the armed forces its laboratory for experiments. "Soldiers serving the army for several years, does the government see this as a burden?" Priyanka's Twitter post read.

166.title: Not political, it's for religious purpose: Aaditya Thackeray on Ayodhya visit
166.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday visited Ayodhya to offer prayers at the Ram temple and said his visit to the temple is not for political benefits. "Shiv Sena leaders and I've visited here for religious purpose...there's no political benefit," he said. Sena leaders Sanjay Raut and Eknath Shinde along with over 1,000 Shiv Sainiks reached Ayodhya for Aaditya's visit.

167.title: Duplicate Surf Excel manufacturing unit busted in Greater Noida
167.article_body: A factory manufacturing fake Surf Excel detergent powder was busted in Greater Noida and one person was arrested in connection with the case, police said on Wednesday. Besides raw material, over 10,000 sachets of 80-gm weight having the label of Hindustan Unilever's Surf Excel brand and over 32,000 unprinted sachets of the same size were seized, a police spokesperson said.

168.title: Ukraine suffering painful losses, needs anti-missile weapons: Zelenskyy
168.article_body: Ukrainian forces are suffering painful losses in fighting Russian troops in the east of the country, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday. He added that Ukraine now needs modern anti-missile weapons and there could be no justification for partner countries to delay delivery. Zelenskyy also said that some Russian rockets are evading Ukrainian defences and causing casualties.

169.title: Hate being categorised as an actor, dislike being put in a box: Radhika
169.article_body: Sharing her opinion on actors being categorised on the basis of mediums they work in, actress Radhika Apte said she "hates" being categorised, adding she doesn't like being "put in a box". "That doesn't mean I can stop people from doing that," stated Radhika. Actor Vikrant Massey said being categorised as an actor bothers him, adding it is unfair.

170.title: Cong to gherao all Raj Bhawans over claims of police entering party office
170.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said the party will gherao all Raj Bhawans across India on Thursday to protest against Delhi Police entering Congress' Delhi headquarters and beating up workers. Several Congress leaders and workers have been protesting outside the party office and ED headquarters since Monday. They're protesting over summons to Rahul Gandhi in National Herald case.

171.title: Send questions via mail: Naveen Jindal to Thane police over Prophet remarks
171.article_body: Expelled BJP leader Naveen Kumar Jindal failed to appear before Bhiwandi Police in Maharashtra's Thane on Wednesday in a case over his alleged derogatory tweets against Prophet Muhammad. Jindal sent a mail to police, saying he was unwell and medically unfit to travel. He asked police to send him questions and he'll respond to them via email through his lawyer.

172.title: Harshal has done everything he can to be in India's squad for T20 WC: Irfan
172.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Harshal Patel has done everything he can to be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "I understand playing in Australia...you need extra pace...[but] he has been outstanding as far as variation is concerned," stated Irfan. Harshal registered figures of 4/25 in the third T20I against South Africa.

173.title: Kejriwal, Mann flag off Jalandhar-Delhi airport Volvo bus service
173.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday flagged off a government-run Volvo bus service connecting Jalandhar to Delhi's IGI airport. The ceremony, which took place at Jalandhar's Shaheed Bhagat Singh Interstate Bus Terminal, was also attended by Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Bhullar. "This marks...end of private transport mafia in Punjab," AAP tweeted.

174.title: Canada ends COVID-19 vaccine mandate for domestic, int'l travel
174.article_body: The Canadian government has announced that it will end COVID-19 vaccine requirement for domestic and international travel from June 20. The decision comes following concerns over hours-long delays at airports. Though the vaccine mandate has been withdrawn for trains and flights, the passengers would still be required to wear masks while travelling.

175.title: Centre will pay hefty price for suppressing Rahul Gandhi’s voice: CM Baghel
