175.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP-led Central government over ED's probe against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. The centre will have to pay a hefty price for attempting to suppress Gandhi's voice, Baghel said. "Be it GST, demonetisation, COVID mismanagement...unemployment...Gandhi has been raising...voice against every important issue," he added.

176.title: FIR against Maha Cong leader for derogatory comments about PM Modi
176.article_body: An FIR was registered in Nagpur against Maharashtra Congress leader Sheikh Hussain for allegedly using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi. "I've not made any personal attack against the PM, only used an idiom in my speech. I spoke in favour of the party. I've not said anything I regret or need to apologise for," he said.

177.title: This is huge, I feel such pride: Janhvi Kapoor on Brahmastra's trailer
177.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor reacted to Brahmastra's trailer that was released earlier today. Taking to Instagram Stories, Janhvi wrote, "This is huge!!! A first for Hindi cinema. Feel such pride to finally see a glimpse of this spectacular vision!! Truly a world like we've never seen before." Alia Bhatt shared the trailer on Instagram and wrote, "A piece of our hearts, 'Brahmastra'."

178.title: Man puts salt in eyes & gets blindfolded, paints Sonu Sood's pic; actor reacts
178.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood shared a video of a man who allegedly put salt in his eyes and got blindfolded before painting the actor's picture at an event. In the video, the man can be seen painting Sood's picture upside down. Several people can be seen looking while the man paints the picture. "What wonderful man," Sonu wrote on Twitter.

179.title: 350-pound bear euthanised after attacking 3-yr-old girl, her mother
179.article_body: A 350-pound black bear was euthanised after ripping into a family's tent and injuring a mother and her three-year-old daughter in the US. The bear allegedly tore through the sleeping family's tent at 5:20 am on Sunday and scratched the mother and the daughter, causing superficial head lacerations. The child's father managed to scare off the bear after several attempts.

180.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out, Kohli drops out of top 2 for first time after 5 years
180.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with Virat Kohli dropping to the third position. It is for the first time in five years that Kohli has dropped out of the first two positions. Pakistan captain Babar Azam remains at the number one spot, while his compatriot Imam-ul-Haq is now the world number two ODI batter.

181.title: Video shows Varun, Kiara eating vada pav in Mumbai Metro; fans react
181.article_body: A video of Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani eating vada pav in a metro in Mumbai while promoting their film 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' went viral on social media. As per Mumbai Metro rules, eating is not allowed inside the metro. "Are eatables allowed inside the...metro?" an Instagram user commented. Another user commented, "Eating isn't allowed...VIP treatment."

182.title: Hyderabad receives rainfall, IMD forecasts more rain till June 18
182.article_body: Rains lashed Hyderabad on Wednesday morning and Kandikal Gate of Bandlaguda Mandal received the highest rainfall at 53.3 mm, as per the Telangana State Development Planning Society. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in the city from June 16 to 18. Southwest Monsoon arrived in Hyderabad on Monday.

183.title: Which are the world's top 10 airlines by customer experience?
183.article_body: Qatar Airways is world's best airline, according to Skytrax. It is followed by Singapore Airlines, ANA: All Nippon Airways, Emirates and Japan Airlines. Cathay Pacific has been ranked 6th, followed by EVA Air, Qantas Airways, Hainan Airlines and Air France. The rankings are based on customer survey period from September 2019 to July 2021.

184.title: Great Indian hornbill tortured before being killed in Nagaland; 3 held as video surfaces
184.article_body: A great Indian hornbill was tortured and beaten with a stick before being killed in Nagaland's Wokha district. Police have arrested three people after the video of the incident was widely shared on social media. "It is indeed too cruel and insane to have acted in such a manner and the culprits should be booked," an NGO said.

185.title: I am not really interested in winning a Grammy: BTS member Jungkook
185.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' member Jungkook said while he knows that winning a Grammy award is a "huge" deal, he is "not really" interested in actually winning one. "I think our status is there whether we win a Grammy or not," added Jungkook. Talking about his voice, Jungkook stated, "There's a lot of times when I don't like it."

186.title: Are we terrorists?: Adhir Ranjan as police detain protesting Cong leaders
186.article_body: As Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared for the third day before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday, party workers and leaders protesting against the ED questioning were detained by police outside the AICC office. "Are we terrorists? Why are you scared of us? They are using police force against Congress leaders and workers," Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said.

187.title: Wouldn't have gone anyway: Owaisi on not being invited to Opposition meet
187.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said he wasn't invited to the meeting of Opposition leaders called by TMC chief Mamata Banerjee in Delhi. "Even if I were invited, I wouldn't have participated," Owaisi added, stating Congress to be the reason behind his decision. Notably, Mamata Banerjee had invited leaders of 22 political parties to discuss strategy for Presidential election.

188.title: Risk of US recession probably at 50% now: Morgan Stanley CEO
188.article_body: The risk of a recession in the US is at about 50%, said Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman. An economic downturn could "fatally damage" some institutions, Gorman said and added that any such decline would likely be short-lived. My focus in more on non-financial risks like data stability, cyber and operations risk, he further said.

189.title: Been told my scripts are 'too much LGBT', don't know what that means: Onir
189.article_body: Filmmaker Onir said that he has been told by platforms that his scripts are 'too much LGBT'. "I don't know what that means," he said, adding, "I am called for Pride webinars...The platforms promise that they will reach out, but I keep sending scripts after the webinar, but don't get any response."

190.title: Telugu subject compulsory for class 1 to 10 in Telangana schools
190.article_body: Telangana government has mandated Telugu as a second language for students of CBSE, ICSE, IB and other board-affiliated schools from Class 1 to 10 starting this academic year. Accordingly, two Telugu textbooks, one for Telugu-speaking students and the other for students whose mother tongue is not Telugu have been designed. Non-compliance with the rule will have repercussions, the circular stated.

191.title: 'Solve dispute in lifetime' approach won’t work with India-China matter: RSS leader
191.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said the approach of 'I should solve this dispute in my lifetime' will not work in the India-China border issue. "Don't be in a hurry for a (Indo-China boundary) solution…It's not going to be solved, because you are not dealing with just any other country, you are dealing with a civilisation, a cultural nation," he added.

192.title: BBMP issues COVID-19 advisories for schools, parents after students test +ve
192.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a set of advisories for schools and parents after 31 students tested COVID-19 positive at two schools. In an advisory, BBMP directed schools to mandatorily conduct thermal screening for all students and staff at the entrance. In another advisory issued for parents, BBMP urged all eligible members in the house to get vaccinated.

193.title: Kept taking my chances: Ruturaj Gaikwad on scoring 5 fours in an over
193.article_body: Talking about scoring five fours in an over during the third T20I against South Africa, opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said, "That (Anrich Nortje over) was the fifth over of the powerplay and...we wanted to...get as many runs as possible." "I...kept...taking my chances and didn't think that we have 10 runs in the over already so I should stop," added Ruturaj.

194.title: UN cuts food aid to 17 lakh people in South Sudan amid funding crisis
194.article_body: At least 17 lakh people in South Sudan will lose access to food aid as the UN World Food Programme (WFP) has suspended its assistance citing a shortage of funds. Among those affected are 1.78 lakh children who will no longer receive school meals, WFP said. Over 60% of the country's population faces severe food insecurity, according to the WFP.

195.title: PM greeted with 'Modi, Modi' chants as 50k people gather to see him in Pune
195.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi', 'Har Har Mahadev' and 'Jai Shree Ram' as he addressed a gathering after inaugurating the Shila temple in Pune's Dehu on Tuesday. Around 50,000 people from Dehu and adjacent villages had gathered to see PM Modi. He inaugurated Sant Tukaram Temple in Dehu.

196.title: 'Agniveers' to get priority in police recruitment in UP: CM Yogi
196.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said 'Agniveers', soldiers who are recruited in the Army, Navy and the Air Force under the 'Agnipath' scheme, will get priority in recruitment to police and related services in the state. "The double-engine government of BJP is dedicated and committed for...upliftment of...youth," Yogi tweeted. Under the scheme, youngsters will be recruited for four years.

197.title: India's trade deficit in May at record $24.3 bn, exports rise 20.55%
197.article_body: India's merchandise exports in May rose 20.55% to $38.94 billion while the trade deficit rose to a record $24.29 billion, up from $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, according to government data released on Wednesday.  Imports in May grew 62.83% to $63.22 billion. Cumulative exports and imports between April 2022-May 2023 rose to $78.72 billion and $123.41 billion respectively.

198.title: Video shows Delhi Police entering Congress HQ, police say 'people threw barricades at us'
198.article_body: Congress has shared a video of Delhi Police personnel entering the party's headquarters amid protests over Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Rahul Gandhi. Calling it a "criminal trespass", Congress alleged policemen also thrashed its workers. Delhi Police said that many people threw barricades at the police near the Congress office but denied that policemen entered the office or used force.

199.title: Ruturaj deserves praise as he played with people behind him to take his spot: Jaffer
199.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India opener Ruturaj Gaikwad deserves praise for his 57-run innings in the third South Africa T20I as he played "with a lot of people sitting behind him to take his spot". Jaffer added, "You've [got] to praise Gaikwad for the way he batted after not being able to score in the first two matches."

200.title: LinkedIn, UN Women partner to advance women empowerment in India
200.article_body: LinkedIn on Wednesday announced partnership with United Nations Women to advance women's economic empowerment in Asia Pacific, beginning with the state of Maharashtra. The LINK Women Project will begin with a 15-month pilot to cultivate the digital, soft and employability skills of 2,000 women. Women who have completed higher education can participate in the project.

201.title: I did do horrible things throughout my relationship, behaved in horrible ways: Amber
201.article_body: In a new interview since Johnny Depp's defamation trial verdict, Amber Heard said the trial was the most "horrible and humiliating" thing she has been through. "I made a lot of mistakes, but I've always told the truth," she added. "I did do and say horrible...things throughout my relationship. I behaved in horrible...ways. I have so much regret," said Amber.

202.title: 455 booked for drunken driving in Noida, Greater Noida in a day
202.article_body: Over 450 people were booked in a day for drunken driving across Noida and Greater Noida in UP, police said on Wednesday. Vehicles and suspicious-looking people were checked during the process, which led to the police penalising 455 people, 181 people in Noida, 224 in central Noida and 50 in Greater Noida.

203.title: Thieves cut open ATM kiosk in Delhi’s Satya Niketan, steal ₹20 lakh
203.article_body: Some unidentified men reportedly cut open an ATM kiosk using a gas cutter in Southwest Delhi's Satya Niketan and stole ₹20 lakh on early Wednesday. "The accused...used a spray on the lens of CCTV cameras...They then used a gas cutter to weaken the base of the ATM and...cut open the iron chest...which had all the cash," police said.

204.title: People walk on hot coal at Switzerland event, treated for burns
204.article_body: As many as 25 people were treated for burn injuries after they walked on hot coal at a private event in Switzerland, said police. The injured were treated at the scene and 13 of them, who suffered severe injuries, were later hospitalised. It was not immediately known why the people walked over hot coal.

205.title: Wife catches her husband with his lover in Chhattisgarh, forces them to parade half-naked
205.article_body: A woman caught her husband with his lover and forced them to parade half-naked in Kondagaon district in Chhattisgarh. After a video of the incident surfaced online, the police arrested her and three others. As per reports, the man and his lover were beaten before being paraded with their hands tied.

206.title: AIIMS issues advisory as man chokes to death while eating momos, says 'swallow with care'
206.article_body: The AIIMS in Delhi has issued a 'swallow with care' warning after a 50-year-old man choked to death while eating momos, according to its forensic department. It advised chewing momos properly instead of just swallowing them. "Virtual autopsy of the deceased indicated that choking occurs when a foreign body is too large to gain access into the trachea," it stated.

207.title: Uma Bharti throws cow dung at liquor shop in MP; video surfaces
207.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti on Tuesday threw cow dung at a liquor shop in Madhya Pradesh's Orchha town amid her demand for total prohibition in the BJP-ruled state. Bharti in a tweet claimed the shop wasn't approved for the spot it was located. It was a "crime" to open such an outlet in the holy town of Orchha, she said.

208.title: Republican Congressman who voted to impeach Donald Trump ousted
208.article_body: Republican Congressman Tom Rice, who voted to impeach former US President Donald Trump after the January 6 Capitol riot, lost his re-election bid in South Carolina on Tuesday. Rice, a five-term South Carolina incumbent, was beaten in a primary election by Trump-backed challenger Russell Fry. Meanwhile, another Republican Nancy Mace who had criticised Trump won the election.

209.title: Vir Das tests +ve for COVID for 2nd time, says 'Woke up with symptoms'
209.article_body: Ahead of his show in Gujarat, actor-comedian Vir Das has tested positive for COVID-19 for the second time. "Woke up showing symptoms, rapid tested and now going to get RT-PCR tested," Vir wrote on Instagram. "Team is currently working on new dates for the Gujarat show," he added. Earlier, Vir had tested positive for COVID-19 in January this year.

210.title: Abortions rose in US, 1 in 5 pregnancies terminated in 2020: Study
210.article_body: About one in five pregnancies in the US ended in abortion in 2020, said a report by the Guttmacher Institute's researchers. The number and rate of abortions in the country rose in 2020 as compared to 2017, it added. While over 8.62 lakh abortions were recorded in 2017, more than 9.3 lakh were seen in 2020.

211.title: 240-metre-long glass bridge with diamond-shaped cafe in middle opens in Georgia
211.article_body: The opening ceremony of the 240-metre-long glass bridge - with a diamond-shaped cafe in the middle - over the Tsalka canyon in Georgia's Tsalka was held on June 14. Pictures of the bridge and the cafe went viral on social media. The project was carried out by the Jewish company Kass Group.

212.title: Veterinary doctor called to check on sick animal kidnapped and forcibly married in Bihar
212.article_body: In a case of 'Pakadua Vivah', a veterinary doctor was kidnapped and forcibly married in Bihar's Begusarai after being called to check on a sick animal. The veterinarian was abducted by three people. "We've asked SHO and other officials to conduct an investigation into the matter. Strict actions will be taken against the accused," said Yogendra Kumar, SP, Begusarai.

213.title: Mumbai receives light drizzle; monsoon spell not expected till June 20: IMD
213.article_body: Light rains were witnessed in South Mumbai, Dadar and a few other areas across Mumbai on Wednesday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicts that Mumbai will receive light rains on Thursday too. It also stated that no active monsoon spell is expected in the city at least till June 20, despite the onset of the southwest monsoon.

214.title: Pics shown on TV, whole life put on display: Javed's daughter on demolition
214.article_body: Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed's daughter Sumaiya Fatima said that photographs were being shown on television when her house was being demolished. "The anchors were pointing towards each item...our whole life was put on display in front of everyone to see and devour. Our memories are attached to those things, but they had no respect for it," she added.

215.title: You can't keep your bat quiet for too long: Irfan on Pant's form
215.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant "has got stuck a lot" in T20Is and needs to perform in the upcoming games. "Time might come [when] you might have to work hard to play in the XI...You already have Karthik and Ishan as wicketkeepers," added Irfan. "You cannot keep your bat quiet for too long," he further said.

216.title: First UK deportation flight to Rwanda cancelled after legal action
216.article_body: The first deportation flight of asylum seekers from the UK to Rwanda was cancelled minutes before take-off on Tuesday after a ruling from the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR). ECHR said the plan carried "a real risk of irreversible harm" to asylum seekers. Britain in April signed a deal with Rwanda to send illegal migrants to the African nation.

217.title: Kamal Haasan meets Tamil Nadu CM Stalin after the success of 'Vikram'
217.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan met Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin after the success of his film 'Vikram'. The actor took to Twitter to share a picture with the CM. Earlier, actor Chiranjeevi hosted the film's success party and actor Salman Khan had also attended the party. The film has earned over ₹300 crore globally.

218.title: Struggling to find words for what we witnessed: Stokes on 5-wicket win vs NZ
218.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he can't find words to describe his feelings after their five-wicket win against New Zealand in the second Test. "[This] blows away Headingley Test [during the Ashes 2019], it blows away the 2019 World Cup final. Just emotionally and the enjoyment of every minute I had on that field, it was incredible," stated Stokes.

219.title: 38-yr-old man robs house in Maharashtra after watching YouTube video, arrested
219.article_body: Police arrested a 38-year-old man from UP for allegedly stealing cash and jewellery worth ₹9.75 lakh after breaking into a house in Maharashtra’s Palghar, an official said. He has no previous criminal record, ACP, Zone-II, Pankaj Shirsat, said. During questioning, the accused told that he learnt about the house-breaking theft from a YouTube video, the official said.

220.title: Agnipath scheme will make army fitter: Vice Chief of Army Staff
220.article_body: Vice Chief of Army Staff BS Raju on Wednesday said the newly launched Agnipath scheme for recruitment in armed forces will lower the average age of soldiers from 32-33 years to approximately 26 years in about 8-10 years. "It'll make the army fitter. We'll be able to handle more challenging situations in difficult areas that troops operate in," he added.

221.title: Tihar authorities to induct dog squad to curb drug, SIM smuggling
221.article_body: Tihar authorities in Delhi are planning to deploy a four-member dog squad to curb smuggling of banned items inside the prison. Accordingly, the dogs will be trained to detect mobile phones, weapons, SIM cards, drugs and tobacco which prisoners carry in their stomach and vomit out on reaching inside. It will be later expanded to Rohini and Mandoli jails.

222.title: Akshay seems to be disinterested in 'Samrat Prithviraj': Komal Nahta
222.article_body: Trade expert Komal Nahta, speaking about the box office failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', said that it was a dangerous project as historical films are always tricky. "Akshay Kumar seems to be totally disinterested. He looked like Akshay Kumar rather than Prithviraj," he added. "Film had bad music...lastly, it didn't invoke any feeling of patriotism," he added.

223.title: Don't tolerate any disrespect after breakup with Bieber: Selena Gomez
223.article_body: Singer-actress Selena Gomez opened up about her break-up with singer Justin Bieber. "It allowed me to develop a character where I don't tolerate any sort of nonsense or disrespect," she stated. Selena and Justin broke up in 2018. A few months later after his break-up, Justin tied the knot with model Hailey Bieber.

224.title: SA were completely out of 3rd T20I by the time Chahal bowled 3 overs: Nehra
224.article_body: Discussing Yuzvendra Chahal's spell in the third T20I against South Africa where he picked three wickets while conceding 20 runs, Ashish Nehra said South Africa were completely out of the match by the time Chahal bowled three overs. "We...[saw] the Chahal...we know, the aggressive Chahal. He varied his pace and length the way he...does when...at his best," added Nehra.

225.title: UAE bans export of Indian wheat till September
225.article_body: The UAE has imposed a moratorium on the export and re-export of wheat and wheat flour from India for four months starting from May 13. The UAE said this decision comes in view of international developments that have affected trade flows and in appreciation of the strategic relations after India's approval to export wheat to the UAE for domestic consumption.

226.title: Covaxin booster dose enhances efficacy against Delta, Omicron variants: Study
226.article_body: A booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin enhances its efficacy against Delta variant and Omicron variants namely, BA.1.1 and BA.2, a study stated. "In vaccine efficacy study against the Omicron variants...lesser virus shedding, lung viral load and lung disease severity were observed," the paper stated. Reduction in lung viral load and lung lesions were observed in Delta variant, it added.

227.title: What is the I2U2 group that comprises India, US?
227.article_body: US has announced a new group named I2U2, which comprises India, Israel, US and UAE. "India is a massive consumer market. It is a massive producer of high-tech and highly sought-after goods as well. So, there are a number of areas where these countries can work together, whether its technology, trade, climate...and potentially even security as well," US said.

228.title: National security being toyed with: Cong over Agnipath recruitment scheme
228.article_body: Congress leader TS Singh Deo on Tuesday questioned the central government's Agnipath recruitment scheme for youth to serve in the Army. "Defence services and national security are being toyed with," Deo said. "What kind of job is this where you'll keep them for four years and then only 25% of them would be allowed to go ahead?" he added.

229.title: Zomato-backed Shiprocket to acquire Pickrr for $200 million
229.article_body: Zomato-backed logistics aggregator Shiprocket has agreed to acquire a majority stake in Pickrr in an estimated $200 million deal comprising cash, stock and earn-out. Pickrr Founders Gaurav Mangla, Ankit Kaushik and Rhitiman Majumder are getting shares in Shiprocket as part of the deal. Shiprocket is also reportedly in the final stages of closing acquisition of the India business of Shyplite.

230.title: Stalin, Thackeray, KCR among leaders to skip Oppn’s meet: Kharge
230.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and many big leaders won’t be participating in the Opposition’s meeting, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Wednesday. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee last week wrote to leaders of 22 parties for the meeting to discuss the Presidential election.

231.title: UP CM asks ministers to refrain from making provocative statements
231.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday asked his ministers to refrain from making provocative statements on any issue that may vitiate the social atmosphere. "Those in government offices should uphold dignity and decorum of their offices," CM Yogi added. He was addressing a meeting of his council of ministers ahead of the bypoll to the two Lok Sabha seats.

232.title: Mumbai airport becomes 1st in India to use wind energy for consumption needs
232.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport has become the first in India to explore utilisation of wind energy for consumption purposes. Under the pilot project, a vertical axis wind turbine (VAWT) unit and solar hybrid (solar mill) have been installed at the airport. According to an official, the technology is expected to generate minimum energy of 36 kWh per day.

233.title: J&K bans schools run by Trust affiliated to Jamaat-e-Islami
233.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has ordered a ban on schools run by Falah-e-Aam Trust (FAT), an affiliate of proscribed organisation Jamaat-e-Islami. It has asked the district authorities to seal all such schools within 15 days. The students studying in these institutions have been asked to get admissions in nearby government schools.

234.title: Stokes said 'Don't even think of hitting on ground': Bairstow on 136 (92)
234.article_body: England batter Jonny Bairstow said Ben Stokes asked him "not" to "even think" about hitting the ball on the ground during his 136 off 92, in England's second innings of the second Test against New Zealand. Bairstow smashed the second-fastest century in Tests by an English cricketer during his innings. He reached the three-figure mark in 77 balls.

235.title: India's 2nd-string squad should be appreciated: Inzamam-ul-Haq
235.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said India should be "appreciated" for keeping the five-match T20I series alive against South Africa after their win on Tuesday. "This shows India's depth. The second-string team is putting up a fight and it's great to see that," he stated. India won the third T20I by 48 runs with Ruturaj Gaikwad and Ishan Kishan scoring half-centuries.

236.title: India's first private train service under Bharat Gaurav scheme flagged off
236.article_body: India's first-ever private train service under Bharat Gaurav scheme flagged off on Tuesday from Coimbatore to Shirdi. "Railways has leased this train to a service provider for a period of two years. It has a total of 20 coaches including first, second and third class AC coaches and sleeper coaches," said B Guganesan, CPRO, Southern Railway.

237.title: Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth shares first pic after getting bail in drugs case
237.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor took to Instagram to share his first photo after getting bail in drugs case. In the photo, he can be seen sitting on a flight. He also gave his official statement regarding the case. "I was at the hotel and there was an investigation going on. I have been cooperating," he said.

238.title: I was so lost: Actor Bradley Cooper on his cocaine addiction
238.article_body: Hollywood actor Bradley Cooper opened up about the drug and alcohol addiction he developed after being relegated to a guest star in the third season of his show 'Alias'. "I was so lost...addicted to cocaine...I severed my Achilles tendon right after I got fired-slash-quit 'Alias'," Bradley stated. Bradley added a "hard conversation" with his friend Will Arnett changed his life.

239.title: Man dies after sliding boat hits him at water park in Jharkhand
239.article_body: A 30-year-old man reportedly died after a sliding boat hit him on the head at a water amusement park in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district on Tuesday. He was declared dead at the hospital. According to police, the park was overcrowded with no arrangements to tackle the crowd. The park has been sealed and police have taken its manager into custody.

240.title: Switzerland closes airspace for security reasons after computer glitch
240.article_body: Swiss airspace was closed for security reasons on Wednesday after a computer glitch with the air traffic control system grounded flights at the country's main airports, officials said. The air traffic control system Skyguide said it "regrets the incident and its consequences for the clients, partners and passengers, and is working flat out to find a solution".

241.title: Abhishek Bachchan, Saiyami Kher's 1st look from R Balki's Ghoomer out
241.article_body: Saiyami Kher shared a picture with Abhishek Bachchan on Twitter revealing the first look from R Balki's 'Ghoomer'. "A project with some of the nicest people I've met. That let me play a sport that I love. That let me play one of the most challenging roles I've played thus far," Saiyami tweeted. Shabana Azmi also features in the film.

242.title: Rahul Gandhi arrives at ED office for third day of questioning
242.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday arrived at the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Delhi for the third consecutive day of questioning in connection with the National Herald case. Meanwhile, women leaders and workers of Congress protested against the ED's action outside the party office in heavy police presence. Gandhi was questioned for several hours on Tuesday.

243.title: 6 injured after speeding water tanker hits them in Delhi's Badarpur
243.article_body: At least six people were injured after a speeding water tanker hit them in Delhi's Badarpur market on Tuesday. According to the police, the tanker driver lost control of the vehicle and hit the crowd. Vegetable carts and vehicles were also damaged in the incident. A case of rash driving and negligence has been registered against the driver, police said.

244.title: 42-year-old man dies after his bike collides with PMPML bus in Pune
244.article_body: A 42-year-old man died of serious head injuries after his motorbike collided head-on with a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus at Padmavati chowk on the Pune-Satara road on Tuesday afternoon. The victim's body has been sent for postmortem. "The PMPML bus has been seized and is at Sahakar Nagar Police Station," police sub-inspector Mahesh Nalavade said.

245.title: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase fires 8% of its India staff
245.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase's decision to cut its workforce will see around 8% of the company's staff being laid off in India, Coinbase’s Senior Director for Market Expansion Durgesh Kaushik said. Coinbase had announced on Tuesday that it is laying off 18% of its workforce worldwide, citing "economic downturn". Earlier in June, Coinbase had extended its hiring freeze.

246.title: Get your s*** together: DOGE co-creator to Twitter on banning meme creators
246.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus shared a meme on Twitter against the platform banning meme creators, saying, "Get your s*** together Twitter." Markus shared the Drake meme suggesting Twitter is inclined to ban meme creators instead of scammers and spam bot accounts. Earlier this month, Twitter reportedly agreed to comply with Elon Musk's demand to share data on bots.

247.title: 2-year-old brutally beaten, punched by maid in Madhya Pradesh; video surfaces
247.article_body: Police in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur have arrested a maid for brutally beating and punching a two-year-old when the kid's parents went out to work. The kid's parents installed a CCTV camera after a doctor found that the child's internal organs were swollen. The maid, identified as Rajini Chaudhury, was hired for a monthly payment of ₹5,000.

248.title: Khalistani posters spotted in Punjab's Jalandhar ahead of Arvind Kejriwal's visit
248.article_body: Khalistani posters were spotted in Punjab on Wednesday, ahead of Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal's visit. Pro-Khalistan slogans were seen written on walls near Jalandhar Shakti Peeth and Devi Talab Mandir, reports said. The police is checking CCTV footage to find out who wrote the slogans. Security has also been ramped up before Kejriwal's visit.

249.title: You will have really bad days: Opener Ruturaj Gaikwad on T20 cricket
249.article_body: India opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said a player will have "really bad" days while playing T20 cricket, adding that one needs to stay consistent mentally and trust the process. Talking about the recently concluded IPL 2022 where he scored 368 runs for CSK, Ruturaj stated, "The wicket was slightly bowler-friendly...It was two-paced, the ball was turning and there was some swing."

250.title: TRS, AAP to skip Mamata Banerjee's opposition meeting in Delhi today: Reports
250.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party and the Telangana Rashtra Samithi have decided to not attend West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's opposition meeting in Delhi today. "Aam Aadmi Party will not participate in the meeting," Free Press Journal quoted a source as saying. "There is no question of sharing any platform with the Congress," TRS in a statement.

251.title: His innings was pure class: Finch on Maxwell's 80*(51) vs SL
251.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch praised all-rounder Glenn Maxwell for his performance in their two-wicket win against Sri Lanka in the first ODI. "That innings by Maxwell was pure class. Showed a lot of skill," stated Finch. Maxwell came in to bat when Australia needed 93 off 84 balls with five wickets remaining and scored unbeaten 80 runs off 51 balls.

252.title: Sister suggested I try modelling, took 2,000 auditions to get breakthrough: Jay
252.article_body: Actor Jay Bhanushali said that his sister had suggested that he should try modelling. He added that he worked on her suggestion later. "The journey is not easy...It has a number of ups and downs. It took me 2,000 auditions to get that breakthrough...Double the number of sleepless nights and hard work to get where I am today," he said.

253.title: Woman who came to Mumbai in search of job gang-raped; relative among 4 held
253.article_body: A 19-year-old married woman, who came to Mumbai in search of job, was allegedly gang-raped in Kurla area, police said on Tuesday. The victim is a resident of Kolkata and had come to Mumbai along with her relative in March, police added. The woman claimed she was gang-raped by her relative and three others following which the accused were apprehended.

254.title: Population isn't a burden for Bihar, says JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar
254.article_body: JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar on Tuesday said that the population is not a burden for Bihar. "We can't debar weaker sections like Dalits, tribals and Muslims from education and health facilities in the name of population control," Kumar added. "After Nagaland, Bihar stabilised its reproduction rate. We are half of the national average," he stated.

255.title: Ticket checker booked for urinating near woman's berth gets bail in Mumbai
255.article_body: Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted pre-arrest bail to a ticket checker booked for urinating near a passenger's berth on condition that he deposits ₹25,000 to Railways. The amount will be used to install a water cooler at Karjat railway station in Thane. He had urinated near a woman passenger's berth in an inebriated state on Hazrat Nizamuddin-Pune Duronto Express.

256.title: I've no link with beginning of COVID: Johar on reports calling his party 'super-spreader'
256.article_body: After reports called his birthday party 'super-spreader' claiming that around 50 guests were infected with COVID-19, Karan Johar said, "We don't know who contracted it and when because there was a lot happening." He added, "I've no connection with the beginning and origin of this pandemic." He stated, "There was another party...there were weddings...there were events, shoots, why blame me?"

257.title: Pharma profits prevail over global good, COVID response must include patent waiver: India
257.article_body: The measures that the World Trade Organisation is negotiating as part of the response to COVID-19 pandemic must include the patent waiver proposal of India and South Africa, said Union Minister Piyush Goyal. He added, "It is sad that the super-profits of a few pharmaceutical companies prevail over global good." He was addressing the 12th ministerial conference of the WTO.

258.title: 'Agniveers' will get priority in jobs in CAPFs, Assam Rifles: MHA
258.article_body: The 'Agniveers' who complete four years' service in the military under the 'Agnipath' scheme will be given priority in recruitment in Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) and Assam Rifles, said the Ministry of Home Affairs. The move will help youngsters trained under the scheme to contribute more to the service and security of the nation, added the ministry.

259.title: India opposes WTO's global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies
259.article_body: At World Trade Organization's conference in Geneva, India opposed a global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said unlike other advanced fishing nations, India doesn't operate huge fishing fleets to exploit the resources indiscriminately. Goyal added that India wants to protect subsidies to poor traditional fishermen as it's a matter of livelihood for them.

260.title: If BJP is a virus, TMC is its vaccine: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee
260.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said the "double-engine government" has failed in Tripura and TMC can give a bright future to the state. "If BJP is...virus, then TMC is its vaccine," Banerjee stated. "BJP's irresponsible...careless comments have created chaos and infighting within...country," he added. He was speaking at a rally in Tripura ahead of the Assembly bypolls.

261.title: Chinese attack would hit global trade more than Ukraine war: Taiwan
261.article_body: Taiwan's top trade negotiator John Deng said a Chinese military attack on the island would harm the global economy more than the Ukraine war. Deng noted that the world relies on Taiwan for semiconductor chips used in electric vehicles and mobile phones, hinting the implications of a Chinese attack would be sweeping for any industry that relies on the technology.

262.title: Cabinet approves auction of 5G spectrum, to be held in July
262.article_body: The Union Cabinet approved a proposal of the Department of Telecommunications to conduct spectrum auction through which spectrum will be assigned to successful bidders for providing 5G services to public and enterprises. A total of 72097.85 MHz of spectrum with a validity period of 20 years will be put to auction to be held by the end of July 2022.

263.title: We import tea on loan, reduce the amount of tea you drink: Pak minister to people
263.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, people in Pakistan have been asked to reduce the amount of tea they drink, with minister Ahsan Iqbal saying that it would cut the country's high import bills. "I appeal to the nation to cut down the consumption of tea by one to two cups because we import tea on loan," Iqbal further said.

264.title: Marcelo is more than a teammate, a brother football gave me: Cristiano
264.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to term his former Real Madrid teammate Marcelo as "more than" a teammate, adding that the Brazilian defender is a "brother" that football gave him. "One of the biggest stars with whom I had the pleasure of sharing a locker room," added Cristiano in the caption. Marcelo won a record 25 trophies at Real Madrid.

265.title: CM Bhagwant Mann launches online driving licence facility in Punjab
265.article_body: Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann launched online driving licence facility in Punjab to enable people to get a learner's driving licence from the comfort of their homes. Applicants can apply for the licence by uploading their Aadhaar cards on the portal and appear in the online test. The facility will save time, money and energy of people, CM Mann said.

266.title: Dying inside, it's time to say 'Ab khel shuru': Ranbir on 'Brahmastra' trailer
266.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a video message by her son and actor Ranbir Kapoor ahead of the trailer launch of 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir, in the video, said that he is eagerly waiting for the audience's reaction to the trailer and movie. "I'm dying inside...it's the right time to say 'Ab khel shuru' [Game begins now]," he added.

267.title: England lose 0-4 against Hungary, record worst home defeat since 1928
267.article_body: England were defeated 0-4 by Hungary in a UEFA Nations League match having lost against them previously in their Nations League opener. England have been handed their worst home defeat in 94 years, with the previous loss resulting in them losing to Hungary for the first time in 60 years. "Tonight is a chastening experience," said England manager Gareth Southgate.

268.title: Expensive digital pics of monkeys are going to improve the world, jokes Gates on NFTs
268.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took a dig at cryptocurrency projects such as NFTs, calling them "shams based on the greater-fool theory". On being asked about what he thinks of Bored Apes, Gates sarcastically said, "Obviously, expensive digital images of monkeys are going to improve the world immensely." He further stated that he's neither long nor short the asset class.

269.title: 'I seek forgiveness for this' says Kiran Bedi over video of her joke on Sikhs
269.article_body: BJP leader Kiran Bedi has apologised over a video of her making a joke on Sikhs at a book launch event on Monday. Bedi tweeted, "What I said to the audience even at my own cost (as I also belong here) be kindly not misread. I seek forgiveness for this." She added, "I'm the last person to cause any hurt."

270.title: It wasn't our best effort, India were the better side: Bavuma after defeat
270.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said Team India were the better side in their third T20I on Tuesday. "As a collective, it wasn't our best effort...With the ball, they put us under pressure...With the batting, we didn't really turn up," he stated. India posted 179/5 and then restricted South Africa to 131 to win the game by 48 runs.

271.title: PM expert in making news, not in creating jobs: Rahul Gandhi
271.article_body: Following PMO’s announcement to recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi is an "expert" in making news. "This is not a government of 'jumlas’, it is a government of ‘maha jumlas’. The Prime Minister is not an expert in creating jobs, but in making ‘news’ on jobs," Gandhi tweeted.

272.title: 17 Hindu refugees from Pakistan get Indian citizenship in Gujarat
272.article_body: As many as 17 Hindu refugees from Pakistan were granted Indian citizenship by Ahmedabad Collector Sandip Sagale. The refugees reportedly thanked the Ahmedabad district administration for showing expediency in granting them citizenship. As per Citizenship Act, foreign nationals living in India for seven or more years get citizenship after following due constitutional procedure.

273.title: Why is WHO working on changing the name of monkeypox virus?
273.article_body: The World Health Organization has said it is working with experts to come up with a new name for monkeypox. It comes after over 30 scientists wrote last week about the "urgent need for a non-discriminatory and non-stigmatising" name for the virus. The current name does not adhere to WHO guidelines that discourage the use of geographic regions or animals.

274.title: Russia tells Ukrainian forces in Sievierodonetsk to lay down arms
274.article_body: Ukrainian fighters holed up in Azot chemical plant in Sievierodonetsk should stop their senseless resistance and lay down arms, said Russia's National Defence Management Centre chief Mikhail Mizintsev. The stranded civilians would be allowed to pass through a humanitarian corridor, he added. According to Ukraine, over 500 civilians are trapped with soldiers inside the plant.

275.title: Ukraine needs more heavy weapons: NATO as Russia intensifies attacks
275.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said the West needs to send "more heavy weapons" to Ukraine as Russia intensifies attacks in eastern Ukraine. Stoltenberg added that NATO was already "stepping up" deliveries and officials would be meeting in Brussels on Wednesday to coordinate further support. Ukraine's Defence Ministry on Tuesday said Kyiv had received just 10% of the weapons it requested.

276.title: Punjab Police gets 7-day remand of Lawrence Bishnoi in Moosewala murder case
276.article_body: A Punjab court has remanded gangster Lawrence Bishnoi to seven-day police custody in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Bishnoi was brought to Mansa on Wednesday and was produced in court after being medically examined. Reports said that Bishnoi is being taken to Mohali by Punjab Police. Police had earlier said that Bishnoi was the mastermind in Moosewala murder case.

277.title: Lucky Singh from 'Lage Raho...' is a rascal, Virus an unhappy man: Boman
277.article_body: Talking about his character Viru Sahastrabudhhe also known as Virus in the film '3 Idiots', actor Boman Irani said he is such an "unhappy" man. "I am...surprised that people...like an unhappy character like Virus because he is so negative," Boman had earlier stated. Boman said his character of Lucky Singh in Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'Lage Raho Munna Bhai' was a "rascal".

278.title: Hope you're at peace: Preity Zinta on Sushant's death anniversary
278.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta, taking to Instagram, shared a picture with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. Along with the picture, Preity wrote, "Hope you are at peace wherever you are #GoneTooSoon." Earlier, actress Rhea Chakraborty took to Instagram and shared pictures with the late actor. "Miss you every day," Rhea captioned the post.

279.title: Pant did many things right in 3rd T20I vs SA, result is evident: Parthiv Patel
279.article_body: Former wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Rishabh Pant "did many things right" in his captaincy in the third T20I against South Africa, which India won by 48 runs. "Pant's bowling changes were much better. Whenever it seemed like South Africa were building a partnership, Chahal was brought into the attack," added Parthiv. Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the game.

280.title: Over 130 hospitalised after gas leak in chemical factory in Iran
280.article_body: More than 130 people were reportedly hospitalised after a nitrogen gas leak occurred in a chemical factory in Iran on Tuesday. The affected people were later released from the hospital, said officials. "The injured mostly suffered from respiratory problems caused by nitrogen gas, which is not dangerous," said an official. The fire caused by the leak was extinguished.

281.title: Ex-Myntra CEO's Mensa Brands acquires smart wearables brand Pebble
281.article_body: Former Myntra CEO and Medlife Co-founder Ananth Narayanan's Mensa Brands has acquired Noida-based smart wearable brand Pebble for an undisclosed sum. Founded in 2013 by father-daughter duo, Ajay Agarwal and Komal Agarwal, Pebble offers audio products, fitness wearables, and charging solutions. Earlier in January, Mensa Brands had acquired the majority stake in personal care brand Florona.

282.title: Outrageous act of political vendetta: Stalin on ED's questioning of Rahul
282.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin condemned the questioning of Congress’ Rahul Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and called it an "outrageous act of political vendetta" against Congress and its leaders. "BJP uses such diversionary tactics to save itself from the public ire," Stalin tweeted. "Political opponents should be fought politically, not by 'forcing' the ED," he added.

283.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia will lose memory: Mishra on Satyendar's memory loss claim
283.article_body: While reacting to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's claim of losing memory due to COVID-19 during questioning in an alleged money laundering case, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said, "If the matter of [him losing] memory is true, then Satyendar Jain is automatically ineligible to become minister...Now the memory of Sisodia and Kejriwal will also go away," Mishra wrote on Twitter.

284.title: Light rainfall likely in Delhi today, temp to drop over next 5 days: IMD
284.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light rainfall with the possibility of thunder and lightning in Delhi today. The minimum temperature is likely to be around 31°C, while the maximum temperature is expected to reach 40°C. IMD has also issued a yellow alert in the national capital for next five days till June 20 in view of the thunderstorms.

285.title: Media’s role is to bring society & govt’s shortcomings to fore: PM Modi
285.article_body: The role of media is to bring to fore shortcomings in society and government and also highlight positive news, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. “As much as the media has right to criticise, it has the same responsibility to bring positive news to fore,” he added. PM Modi addressed an event to commemorate 200 years of Mumbai Samachar newspaper.

286.title: Man seeking MBBS admission for daughter cheated of ₹8 lakh in Pune
286.article_body: Pune Police have booked a woman lawyer for allegedly cheating a man of ₹8 lakh by promising to get his daughter enrolled in DY Patil college, Nerul, for the MBBS course. As per police complaint, the accused pretended that she'd good relations with the owner of the college, Satej Patil. The complainant met accused at a function in September 2021.

287.title: India reports 8,822 new COVID-19 cases, highest in 3 months
287.article_body: India on Wednesday reported a new high in three months in the daily COVID-19 tally with 8,822 new cases in the last 24 hours, taking the overall count to 4,32,45,517. According to the Health Ministry data, a total of 15 deaths have been reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total fatalities due to the virus to 5,24,792.

288.title: Amit Mishra's ‘Can fly low-on-fuel plane with faulty engine' tweet on Hardik goes viral
288.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra's tweet describing Hardik Pandya's knock of 31*(21) in third T20I against South Africa went viral. Referring to Hardik being dropped for 1 and edging a few deliveries, Mishra wrote, "Hardik...is so lucky...that he can fly a low-on-fuel plane, with a faulty engine, in a thunderstorm and yet can land it safely to the destination."

289.title: Video shows Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra's national record-breaking throw
289.article_body: The Sports Authority of India has shared a video of India's Olympic gold-medal winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra's national record-breaking throw at the Paavo Nurmi Games in Finland. The 24-year-old bettered his own national record with a best throw of 89.30 metres. He clinched silver medal at the tournament, just 0.53 metres behind the winner.

290.title: TV actors have never really been welcomed in B'wood: Urvashi Dholakia
290.article_body: TV actress Urvashi Dholakia has said, "Television actors have never really been welcomed in Bollywood, if I may say so." However, she added, "Things might've changed now and actors are being looked upon differently today." Urvashi stated she was happy working in television and she had everything she wanted at that time. "I became popular overnight...across the globe," she stated.

291.title: China lifts COVID-19 visa ban on Indians after 2 years
291.article_body: China has announced plans to provide visas to Indian professionals and their families stranded in India for over two years. On Monday, Chinese Embassy in India updated its COVID-19 visa policy after over two years. China is also processing requests of thousands of Indian students studying in Chinese institutions who have conveyed their interest to re-join their colleges and universities.

292.title: Strawberry Moon lights up the sky across the world, pics surface
292.article_body: This year's Strawberry Moon was seen in the night sky across the world on Tuesday night. The Strawberry Moon was closer to the Earth and larger than an average full Moon this year, the NASA said. The Strawberry Moon gained its name from the strawberry harvesting season in northeastern North America.

293.title: 10-year-old boy rescued from borewell in Chhattisgarh after 106 hours, rushed to ICU
293.article_body: Rahul Sahu, a 10-year-old boy who had fallen into a 60-feet-deep borewell in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir Champa district, was rescued after a 106-hour-long operation on Tuesday night, officials said. He was then rushed to Apollo Hospital in Bilaspur on a green corridor. "He is currently kept in the ICU under the supervision of a team of specialist doctors," tweeted CMO Chhattisgarh.

294.title: No census this year, deadline to freeze administrative boundaries extended
294.article_body: The Registrar General of India (RGI) on Tuesday sent a letter to all states and Union Territories informing that the deadline to freeze administrative boundaries has been extended to December 31, 2022. This has ruled out the possibility of a census this year. The census, originally scheduled for 2021, could be pushed to 2023-24 after the administrative boundaries are frozen.

295.title: Rahul and Priyanka meet Sonia Gandhi at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi
295.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra met their mother and Congress leader Sonia Gandhi at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi on Tuesday. Sonia has been admitted to hospital due to COVID-19 related issues. She had tested positive for COVID-19 on June 2 and sought more time from ED to appear for questioning in a money laundering case.

296.title: World's 5th richest man Warren Buffett donates $4 billion to charity
296.article_body: As part of his pledge to give away nearly all of his net worth, Warren Buffett donated about $4 billion to Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust and four family charities. Since 2006, the world's 5th richest man has donated more than half of his Berkshire shares, with the donations worth about $45.5 billion at the time they were made.

297.title: I changed my seam position: Yuzvendra Chahal on 3/20 vs SA
297.article_body: Team India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who was named Player of the Match for registering figures of 3/20 in the third T20I against South Africa, said he changed his seam position and focused on his strengths in the game. "I didn't bowl well in the previous games, the coach asked me to back my strengths...I focused on that," he stated.

298.title: Terrorist who shot bank manager in Kulgam, killed in encounter
298.article_body: One out of the two Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists, who were killed on Wednesday in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, was involved in the killing of Vijay Kumar, a bank manager from Kulgam, Kashmir Zone Police tweeted. He has been identified as Jan Mohd Lone, police added. The Jammu and Kashmir Police and security forces conducted the operation jointly.

299.title: SRK, Salman danced to 'Bhangda...': Karan Johar on his 50th b'day
299.article_body: Karan Johar said Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan danced to the song 'Bhangda Paale' from their film 'Karan Arjun' at his 50th birthday party. "Ranveer Singh was the incharge of...music...The party was...at 10-11 pm...but he came to Yash Raj Studio at 4 just to...check [the sound]," added Karan. "It was like every star hitting the dance floor," he stated.

300.title: Warner Bros Discovery may cut 1,000 global ad sales jobs: Report
300.article_body: Warner Bros Discovery is looking to cut up to 30% or nearly 1,000 jobs in its global advertising sales team, Reuters reported citing a source. It has offered members of its US advertising sales team an opportunity to voluntarily leave the company. The firm has a goal of achieving $3 billion in cost savings.

301.title: Ranbir said 'Please don't call me, I get tensed': Karan on 'Koffee With Karan'
301.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that actor Ranbir Kapoor has asked him to not call him on the new season of 'Koffee With Karan'. "He has told me 'I'm not coming on the show...you have to pay the price for it for too long, why should I do this to myself?'...He said 'I feel tensed'," Karan added.

302.title: 2 men posing as customers steal gold jewellery worth ₹20 lakh in Noida
302.article_body: Two men posing as customers at a jewellery shop at Atta Market in Noida's Sector-27 fled with gold jewellery worth ₹20 lakh. The incident occurred on Tuesday when the accused asked for some gold jewellery, police said. One of them sneaked the jewellery inside his clothes and left the shop while the other engaged the owner in conversation, police added.

303.title: 31 students of 2 schools in Bengaluru test positive for COVID-19
303.article_body: Thirty-one students from two schools in Bengaluru's Dasarahalli tested positive for COVID-19. The students were tested when a Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) team went to the schools on June 9 to vaccinate the children against COVID-19 and found some of them showing symptoms. The schools have been sanitised and BBMP has directed them to follow COVID-19 protocols.

304.title: Satyendar Jain said he lost memory after COVID-19 when faced with hawala documents: ED
304.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate told a court that Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said he was suffering from memory loss due to COVID-19 when he was confronted with documents in connection with alleged hawala transactions. The ED also claimed that despite showing him documents, where he had signed in the capacity of the President, Jain completely disassociated himself from a trust.

305.title: Execution was spot-on from bowlers, batters: Pant on 48-run win vs SA
305.article_body: Team India stand-in captain Rishabh Pant said the execution was spot-on as they won by 48 runs in the third T20I against South Africa on Tuesday. "Bowlers did a fantastic job for us. In India, spinners play a big role...[and] when they come off nicely then matches like this happen," he added. Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the game.

306.title: 3 students, including minor, feared drowned at Mumbai's Juhu beach
306.article_body: Three of a group of four students, including a 16-year-old boy, were feared drowned at Mumbai's Juhu beach on Tuesday afternoon. All four, residents of Vashi Naka in Chembur, had arrived at the beach together and were pulled in by the waves. Though Abhishek managed to swim ashore with help from a lifeguard, his three friends are feared drowned.

307.title: Admissions closing soon for IIM-I & Jigsaw's Product Management program
307.article_body: Admissions are closing soon for the 7th batch of Jigsaw's Product Management program designed, delivered & certified by IIM Indore. The program features 5i Framework-based curriculum, Harvard Business case studies and BYOP feature. As per Glassdoor, the average salary for Product Managers in India is ₹15 lakh. Now is the right time to upskill in this domain, Jigsaw said.

308.title: Daughter made my profile on dating site, insisted I go on dates: Suchitra
308.article_body: Actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, who acted in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa', said her daughter Kaveri created a profile for her on a dating site being a single parent after her divorce with director Shekhar Kapur. "She insisted...I go on...dates," added Suchitra. Discussing her relationships, she stated, "Post my divorce I had one relationship...Thankfully nobody knows about it."

309.title: Reports of being cut from 'Aquaman 2' slightly insane: Amber Heard
309.article_body: Amber Heard has responded to reports of being entirely cut from 'Aquaman 2'. As per the People magazine, the actress' spokesperson said, "The rumour mill continues as it has from day one...inaccurate, insensitive...slightly insane." Amber portrays the role of Mera in the film and during Johnny Depp's defamation trial, she said she fought hard to stay in the film.

310.title: Work with greater dedication for victory: CM Jairam tells party workers
310.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur urged BJP party workers to work with greater dedication and commitment to ensure BJP was re-elected in the upcoming assembly elections so that the pace of development in the state is uninterrupted. "Only in BJP...a common worker rises to the topmost position, while all other political outfits are headed by families," he said.

311.title: Ganguly tags wrong Chhetri in tweet, he says 'Hi Sourav, this is Sunil from Nepal'
311.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly tagged the wrong Sunil Chhetri in his tweet congratulating the Indian men's football team captain and the team on qualifying for the AFC Asian Cup. The person Ganguly tagged in his post responded, saying, "Hi Sourav, this is Sunil from Nepal, not your captain Sunil Chhetri. Please correct your mention for your captain."

312.title: I've 30 days to pick up my entire life & leave Singapore: Coinbase manager after lay-off
312.article_body: After being laid off, Coinbase APAC Recruitment Manager Clinton Gleave wrote on LinkedIn, "After building our entire APAC expansion from scratch...even overperforming...I've been laid off." He added, "I've 30 days to pick up my entire life & leave Singapore...I know CEO [Brian Armstrong] didn't make this decision lightly...& have nothing but respect for [him]...but that doesn't change the impact."

313.title: 12 -year-old boy crushed under rear wheels of school bus, dies in Pune
313.article_body: A 12 -year-old boy was crushed to death by a school bus in Pune. Reports said that the school bus was dropping students back home when the incident took place. Police said that the bus took a turn, after which, the boy was crushed under the rear wheels of the vehicle. The 49-year-old driver of the bus has been booked.

314.title: Internet Explorer shut down from today after 27 years
314.article_body: Microsoft today officially shut down its web browser, Internet Explorer, 27 years after it made its debut. Starting today, those who try to open the application will be directed to the company's more recent browser Microsoft Edge. Internet Explorer was launched in 1995 as an add-on package for Windows 95.

315.title: Won't tolerate forced conversions, will tweak law if needed: Goa CM
315.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said that illegal religious conversions by inducement or duress will not be tolerated and that the anti-conversion law may be modified to check it. "At present, the law is weak. My legal team is studying it. If any changes are required, they will be carried out," Sawant said.

316.title: Actor Karanvir, 5 others cheated me of ₹1.99 crore; he threatened to shoot me: Woman
316.article_body: A case has been registered against six people including actor Karanvir Bohra for allegedly cheating a 40-year-old woman of ₹1.99 crore after promising to return it at 2.5% interest, police said. The woman claimed that when she asked for the amount, Bohra and his wife Tajinder Sidhu did not respond properly and threatened to shoot her, police added.

317.title: Authorities step up measures to deal with rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi
317.article_body: Authorities have ramped up measures to tackle the current spike in COVID-19 cases in Delhi. Deploying more people for monitoring home isolation cases, restocking medicines and aggressive contact tracing are some of the measures being undertaken. Ensure genome sequencing of COVID-19 cases to detect emergence of new variants, Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena had directed officials on Monday.

318.title: Excited about 1st day of school, 4-yr-old falls off terrace in Thane
318.article_body: A 4-year-old died after allegedly falling off the fifth-floor terrace at Geeta Apartment in Thane West's Panch Pakhadi area. The deceased was to attend school for the first time on Tuesday, his family told the police. The family believes that he must've tried to look down when he lost his balance and fell.

319.title: India defeat Hong Kong 4-0, qualify for 2023 AFC Asian Cup as group winners
319.article_body: India defeated Hong Kong 4-0 on Tuesday to qualify for the 2023 AFC Asian Cup as group winners. India finished first in Group D in the third round of 2023 AFC Asian Cup qualifiers with nine points. The Indian men's football team have booked their place in back-to-back AFC Asian Cup editions for the first time.

320.title: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra breaks his own national record
320.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra on Tuesday broke his own national record at the Paavo Nurmi Games in Finland. The 24-year-old bagged silver medal in the event with a best throw of 89.30 metres. He had set the previous national record with an 88.07-metre throw in March 2021.

321.title: BTS band members break down while announcing indefinite break
321.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' members RM, Jin, Suga, J-Hope, Jimin, V and Jungkook on Tuesday announced they are taking an indefinite hiatus to focus on solo pursuits. They shared this during their streamed annual Festa dinner, part of a celebration that marks their anniversary as a group. Several of the members broke down while talking about taking time off.

322.title: Jury heard testimony from paid employees and randos: Amber on Depp's witnesses
322.article_body: In her first interview since she lost the defamation trial to Johnny Depp, Amber Heard said the trial wasn't fair. When asked about the jury, she said, "How could they make a judgment?...They...sat in those seats and heard...testimony from paid employees and towards the end of the trial, randos." However, she insisted that she did not blame the jury.

323.title: Those who say cinema is dead aren't looking in right places: H'wood writer on RRR
323.article_body: Hollywood writer Larry Karaszewski, known for writing postmodern biopics, praised filmmaker SS Rajamouli's film 'RRR'. Taking to Twitter, Larry tweeted, "Those who say cinema is dead aren't looking in the right places. #RRR." RRR's official Twitter handle commented on Larry's tweet and wrote, "Thanks for your kind words. Hope you enjoyed the film as well, sir."

324.title: Mom gave up on her dream to become an actor because of me: Sikandar on Kirron
324.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher said that his mother, Kirron Kher had come to Mumbai to become an actor but since he was very young at the time, she focused on raising him. "She gave up on that dream so that she could look after me, missing out on her prime years," he added. "That extent of selflessness is rare," Sikandar said.

325.title: Canada & Denmark divide island, end 50-yr-long ownership dispute
325.article_body: Canada and Denmark have decided to divide a small, uninhabited island in the Arctic called the 'Hans Island', ending a 50-year-long ownership dispute between the countries. The island, with an area of 1.2 square kilometres, is equidistant from both Canada's Ellesmere Island and Denmark's Greenland. Both countries had laid claim to the island since 1971.

326.title: An innings of a lifetime: Sehwag on Bairstow's 136(92) in 2nd Test vs NZ
326.article_body: Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to praise batter Jonny Bairstow following his 92-ball 136 in England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in second Test at Trent Bridge. "Bairstow, an innings of a lifetime, one of the best counter-attacking fourth innings you'll ever see. Well done England, Test cricket is best cricket," he wrote. England lead the three-match Test series 2-0.

327.title: Every year 2 crore jobs announced by Modi govt: Sitaram Yechury
327.article_body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury criticised PM Narendra Modi's instruction to recruit 10 lakh people in the next 18 months and said that every year two crore jobs had been announced by the Modi government. "How many times have you heard such a thing in the last 8-10 years?" Yechury said. He called the move "gross injustice to the youth".

328.title: Attempt to fool the masses: TMC on PM's recruitment announcement
328.article_body: TMC criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's instruction to recruit 10 lakh people in the next 18 months, calling it an attempt to "fool the masses" before 2024 polls. "None of the promises made by BJP and PM Narendra Modi has ever been fulfilled," TMC's Partha Chatterjee said. BJP comes up with a new trick every time election approaches, he added.

329.title: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny moved to undisclosed location
329.article_body: Jailed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny has been shifted to an undisclosed location, his close aide has confirmed. Navalny, who is serving an 11.5-year-long jail sentence for alleged fraud at a penal colony near Moscow, was reportedly transferred without receiving prior notice. Navalny was poisoned by what the West said was a nerve agent in 2020.

330.title: Jonny Bairstow smashes the second-fastest Test hundred by an England cricketer
330.article_body: Jonny Bairstow on Tuesday smashed the second-fastest Test hundred by an England cricketer after reaching the three-figure mark off 77 deliveries in his team's second innings in the second Test against New Zealand. Bairstow went on to score 136 runs off 92 deliveries. England chased down a 299-run target on the last day of the Test in just 50 overs.

331.title: Tesla India policy executive quits after company puts India plan on hold: Report
331.article_body: Tesla's Policy and Business Development executive for India and new markets in South East Asia, Manuj Khurana, has resigned weeks after the carmaker put on hold its plans to sell electric cars in the country, Reuters reported. Khurana was appointed to the role in March 2021 and was lobbying the Indian government to slash the import tax on electric cars.

332.title: WHO to hold emergency meet next week to determine if monkeypox is an emergency
332.article_body: WHO said it would hold an emergency meeting on June 23 to determine whether to classify the global monkeypox outbreak as a public health emergency of international concern. "The global outbreak of monkeypox is unusual and concerning," said WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus. "We believe it needs...some coordinated response because of the geographic spread," he told reporters.

333.title: The lows have taught me a lot, made me a stronger person: Saiyami Kher
333.article_body: Actress Saiyami Kher said her career has been a roller coaster ride with lots of ups and downs. "The downs have taught me...and made me a stronger person and actor. The highs make it all worth the wait," she added. "My attempt has...been to play a new character and try portraying the most honest version of that life," she added.

334.title: Afghanistan complete 3-0 T20I series whitewash against Zimbabwe
334.article_body: Afghanistan completed a 3-0 whitewash against Zimbabwe in the T20I series after a 35-run win in the third and final T20I in Harare. Afghanistan's 17-year-old spinner Noor Ahmad, who posted bowling figures of 4-0-10-4 on his international debut, was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. Afghanistan scored 125/8 in 20 overs and restricted Zimbabwe at 90/9 in 20 overs.

335.title: Demolitions attributable to a state policy which is illegal: Ex-judges to SC
335.article_body: Several retired judges and senior advocates have filed a petition in the Supreme Court, claiming that the demolitions of violence accused's houses in UP is "attributable to a state policy which is illegal". The petition urged SC to take immediate suo motu action. UP CM Yogi Adityanath's remarks emboldened police to "brutally, and unlawfully, torture protestors", the petition further said.

336.title: Tomb with 'Do not open' warning in blood-red text discovered in Israel
336.article_body: A tomb with a warning written in blood-red text, which warns against opening it, has been discovered in Israel. It was found by archaeologists in a recently discovered cave within an old cemetery in the Galilee. Israel's official Twitter account shared the photos and wrote, "An 1,800 year old grave marker for a Jewish man named Jacob the Convert."

337.title: Police take down posters of Ranchi violence accused across city citing 'error'
337.article_body: Hours after putting up posters across the city of the persons accused in the recent violent protests in Jharkhand's Ranchi, police removed them citing "some error" in the posters. "They are removed, but will be put up again after correction," Ranchi Police added in a statement. So far, police have arrested six persons in connection with the violence.

338.title: SP expels MLA Rajesh Kumar Shukla for crossing over to BJP in MP
338.article_body: The Samajwadi Party said it has expelled MLA Rajesh Kumar Shukla from the party's primary membership for "anti-party activities" and for switching over to BJP in Madhya Pradesh. "We are also trying to ensure that his Assembly membership gets terminated," SP's Madhya Pradesh unit president Ramayan Patel said. Shukla, along with two other legislators, joined BJP in Bhopal on Tuesday.

339.title: India record their biggest T20I victory against South Africa, stay alive in the series
339.article_body: India defeated South Africa by 48 runs in the third T20I in Visakhapatnam to stay alive in the five-match series after having lost the first two T20Is. The victory is India's biggest (by runs) against South Africa in T20Is. India's previous biggest T20I victory against South Africa had come on September 20, 2007, when they won by 37 runs.

340.title: Mobile phones will be confiscated if found in schools: TN Minister
340.article_body: Tamil Nadu School Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi on Tuesday warned students against carrying mobile phones to classes and said that they would be confiscated if found in schools. "The young minds should be refreshed through education curriculum," he said. The minister's message comes a day after the schools for classes 1 to 10 re-opened on Monday.

341.title: Gambhir has the best cricketing brain in LSG squad: Jasmer Dhankhar
341.article_body: Jasmer Dhankhar, who served as a reserve player at LSG camp in IPL 2022 season, said mentor Gautam Gambhir had the "best cricketing brain" in the team's squad. "I liked how he thinks in a very distinct way," he added. "He is a very honest and upbeat individual. Every squad needs someone with his characteristics," Dhankhar further said.

342.title: I asked Bhuvneshwar if he had any goals in IPL, 'purple cap' he said: Steyn
342.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn disclosed a conversation that took place between him and pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar during the IPL 2022 season. "I asked him [Bhuvneshwar] if he had got any goals for the IPL and he secretly said to me, 'I would like to win the purple cap again'," said Steyn. Bhuvneshwar took 12 wickets in 14 matches.

343.title: Time for Opposition parties to come together on 1 platform: Baghel
343.article_body: Congress leader and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday said that the time has come for the Opposition parties to consider coming together on a single platform. He said that the leaders of different political parties are being harassed by using ED, Income Tax Department or CBI against them. BJP is making all efforts to suppress the Opposition, he added.

344.title: Rescue op for Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell continues for 100 hrs
344.article_body: A rescue operation to save an 11-year-old boy who fell into an 80-feet-deep borewell in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir-Champa district completed 100 hours on Tuesday. The child was breathing but not showing any movement, as per people involved in the rescue work. A green corridor has been created to shift the boy to a hospital in Bilaspur after he is rescued.

345.title: 7 people injured in a bear attack in MP's Shivpuri
345.article_body: Seven persons, including a 70-year-old man, were injured when a bear attacked them while fetching water in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri, a forest department official said. The bear entered Gajigarh, a tribal-dominated village, in search of water. On finding a water tank, where a number of locals were standing to collect water, it attacked them from behind, the official said.

346.title: Unnecessary & oppressive: TS Singh Deo on ED summon to Rahul Gandhi
346.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo criticised ED summon to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, calling it "unnecessary and oppressive". "It doesn't seem they have a question they want to ask. If they had, they would've asked directly [that] wouldn't have taken over 1-2 hours," Deo said. Rahul Gandhi was summoned by the ED in the National Herald money laundering case.

347.title: PM's security asks Aaditya to get off father Uddhav's car over no name on VIP list: Report
347.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's security on Tuesday asked Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray to get off CM Uddhav Thackeray's car as his name wasn't on the list of VIPs scheduled to receive the PM in Mumbai, according to reports. Uddhav reportedly told the security that Aaditya wasn't merely his son but also a minister. Aaditya was later allowed to travel with him.

348.title: Giving UniCredit's Russian arm away for free would be immoral: CEO
348.article_body: UniCredit CEO Andrea Orcel on Tuesday said giving up the bank's Russian arm for free wouldn't be "morally correct". "We would be gifting something worth €3 billion for nothing to someone who is probably in a leadership that we have decided to veto," Orcel said. UniCredit's abrupt departure from Russia would hurt its 4,000 local staff and customers, he added.

349.title: Rahul questioned for over 8 hrs by ED for 2nd consecutive day; summoned again: Report
349.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate to appear before it on Wednesday, after questioning him for over eight hours in connection with National Herald case on Tuesday, according to reports. This comes after he was questioned for around 10 hours on Monday after he appeared before the agency at 11:30 am.

350.title: 6 dead, 14 injured as vehicle hit by tanker overturns, falls into ditch in UP
