350.article_body: Six persons died and 14 others were injured when their tractor-trolley overturned and fell into a ditch after being hit by a tanker on Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly-Agra road on Tuesday, police said. The deceased had gone to take a dip in river Ganga in the tractor-trolley. Police added that the tanker hit the vehicle in an attempt to overtake it.

351.title: Felt my brand was over after being diagnosed with cancer: Sonali Bendre
351.article_body: Sonali Bendre revealed that she felt that her "brand" was over after she was diagnosed with cancer. "We are in a visual industry, it is about the looks...you need a face that [has]...got certain sort of pleasantness for the camera," she said. The actress added that her son was a driving factor that helped her battle cancer.

352.title: Shah Rukh Khan to play scientist in Ranbir, Alia starrer Brahmastra: Reports
352.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly play a scientist in Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. According to reports, his role is quite important for the film's story graph and is at least of around 15-20 minutes. Reports added that Shah Rukh completed shooting his part a few months ago and is looking forward to the film's release.

353.title: Cong's Surjewala, other party leaders continue to be in police detention
353.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala, AICC Secretary Pranav Jha and NSUI chief Neeraj Kundan along with other party leaders continue to be detained after protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi in Delhi on Tuesday. Sharing a picture on social media, Surjewala said Congress leaders were detained in various police stations for over 10 hours. "What's our crime?" he wrote.

354.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.2%, EMIs to go up
354.article_body: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points, or 0.2%, across all loan tenors. Since consumer loans like home loans and car loans are linked with MCLR, EMIs will go up with the increase in lending rate. The new rates come into effect from June 15.

355.title: Tesla India policy head quits after firm halts India launch: Report
355.article_body: Tesla's India Policy and Business Development head Manuj Khurana has resigned, weeks after the company halted its plans to sell EVs in India, Reuters reported. Khurana had played a key role in forming a domestic market-entry plan for Tesla. The company's plan to launch in India was halted after the Centre insisted Tesla to first commit to manufacturing cars locally.

356.title: Indian woman cheats man on matrimony site in Singapore, jailed
356.article_body: A 51-year-old Indian-origin woman has been sentenced to seven months in prison in Singapore for allegedly cheating a man with a fake matrimony profile. The accused, Maliha Ramu, allegedly pretended to be a 25-year-old single woman on a matrimony website and cheated the victim of over SGD 5,000 (₹2.8 lakh). Maliha had reportedly used her relative's photos on the website.

357.title: Trent Boult creates world record, scores most runs at no. 11 in Test cricket history
357.article_body: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult broke the world record for scoring the most runs batting at number 11 in Test cricket. With his 17(15) in New Zealand's second innings in the second Test against England, he took his tally of runs at number 11 to 640. He overtook ex-Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, who scored 623 runs at the position.

358.title: Indian businessman distributes ₹5 lakh to locals in Sri Lanka; gets caught
358.article_body: An Indian businessman named Ravinder Reddy was detained for questioning by Sri Lanka police recently after he was caught distributing ₹5 lakh to Sri Lankans. Reddy said he visited Sri Lanka every month and has been giving food and money to locals to help them during economic crisis. "The CID people took picture[s] of me, [then] caught me," he added.

359.title: Foxconn's Bharat FIH gets SEBI's nod to raise ₹5,000 crore via IPO
359.article_body: Bharat FIH, the Indian arm of iPhone maker Foxconn, has received market regulator SEBI's approval for raising ₹5,000 crore through an IPO. The public issue comprises fresh issue of shares worth ₹2,502 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to ₹2,502 crore. Bharat FIH has reserved 75% shares for qualified institutional buyers and 15% shares for non-institutional investors.

360.title: Power demand crosses 12,000 MW in Punjab on 1st day of paddy sowing
360.article_body: The power demand in Punjab crossed 12,000 MW on the first day of paddy sowing by the conventional puddling method. Punjab Power Minister Harbhajan Singh, on Tuesday, claimed that an eight-hour power supply was ensured to areas that started the transplantation. In the first phase, Hoshiarpur, Jalandhar, Nawanshahr, Kapurthala, Pathankot, Gurdaspur, Amritsar and Rupnagar started the paddy sowing.

361.title: BJP is scared of me, I dare CBI, ED to touch me: Abhishek Banerjee
361.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said the BJP is scared of him and further dared the CBI and ED to touch him "if they've the guts". His remarks came after CBI officers reached his residence to question his wife in connection with a coal smuggling case. TMC will reinstall democracy, he added.

362.title: 25-yr-old arrested from UP for objectionable post on Prophet
362.article_body: A 25-year-old man from UP's Ballia was arrested for allegedly uploading an objectionable post on Prophet Muhammad on social media, a police officer said on Tuesday. The matter came to light after two persons tweeted to the Ballia Police with a screenshot of the offensive post and urged the police to take action, said Rasra Circle Officer Shiv Narain Vaish.

363.title: Rafael Nadal begins training on grass after foot treatment: Report
363.article_body: Rafael Nadal has begun training on grass behind closed doors in Mallorca, according to a Spanish newspaper. The 36-year-old, who won a record-extending 22nd Grand Slam at 2022 French Open, is yet to decide whether or not he'll play at Wimbledon following his latest treatment for his chronic foot problem. Nadal hasn't competed in the grass season since 2019 Wimbledon.

364.title: Media house shares pic of Virat-Anushka's daughter, actress says 'Learn from others'
364.article_body: Anushka Sharma criticised a media house after it recently posted a picture of her daughter Vamika on Instagram. "Seems like Times Group knows what's better for kids than their parents themselves as they can't stop...posting photos despite being requested repeatedly. Learn something from other media houses and paparazzi," she commented. The post was later deleted by the media house.

365.title: Russia destroys last bridge in Ukrainian city, civilians trapped
365.article_body: Russia has eliminated the last bridge connecting Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to the other parts of the country amid the ongoing war, a Ukrainian official said on Tuesday. Ukrainian regional governor Sergei Gaidai stated that about 70% of the city is now under Russian control, adding that civilians are trapped. Russia has asked Ukrainian fighters in Sievierodonetsk to surrender by Wednesday.

366.title: Maharashtra govt makes rural stint mandatory for MBBS students
366.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced that, starting academic year 2022-2023, Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) graduates will have to compulsorily complete their one-year rural stint after completing their course. An official circular further states that without completing the rural stint, students will not be considered eligible to apply for postgraduate entrance tests.

367.title: Aamir celebrates mom's b'day with ex-wife Kiran Rao, son Azad; video surfaces
367.article_body: Aamir Khan celebrated his mom Zeenat Hussain's birthday with his ex-wife Kiran Rao, son Azad Rao Khan and his relatives. In the video that surfaced online, Aamir was seen sitting with his mother, son Azad and Kiran. Azad can be seen helping his grandmother blow the candles placed on the cake and can be seen singing happy birthday.

368.title: OTT braver, more mature than films on love, relationships: Chitrangda
368.article_body: Actress Chitrangda Singh stated that OTT content is braver and more mature and experimental in portraying love and relationships. She added that there is an allowance for realism on the web which the audience expects. The actress further said that filmmakers think, "Is it this or that formula," adding that they are still gauging what the change is about.

369.title: Bulletproof cars, 50 police personnel part of plan to take Lawrence Bishnoi to Punjab
369.article_body: Punjab Police have submitted in a Delhi court that there will be about 50 police personnel and two bulletproof vehicles to take gangster Lawrence Bishnoi to the state. The police also said that 12 vehicles will run on the way to clear the route, adding, "All routes will be videographed." The court allowed Punjab Police to formally arrest the gangster.

370.title: Fame as a beast can overpower you, it can take everything away: Abhay
370.article_body: Speaking about keeping his life private, actor Abhay Deol said, "Fame as a beast can overpower you, and take away everything and suddenly you don’t have a personal life anymore." "Whereas I made a conscious effort, letting people believe what they want to believe. As long as I have my privacy, they can say whatever they want," he added.

371.title: People should understand Sonia, Rahul's chronology of corruption: BJP
371.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra has said people should try to understand Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's "chronology of corruption". "I want to know how this mother-son duo looted people's wealth," he added. Patra's comments come as Rahul Gandhi, who was probed by Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald case yesterday, was summoned again today.

372.title: Will Smith devastated over slapping Chris Rock at Oscars: Tyler Perry
372.article_body: Actor Tyler Perry has revealed that Will Smith was "devastated" after slapping comedian Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars. He further said that it was extremely painful for Will, adding that Chris is a "pure champion" for handling the painful situation incredibly well. "[Will] couldn't believe what happened. He couldn't believe he did it," Tyler added.

373.title: Inclusivity of physically-challenged increasing in India: Para shooter Avani
373.article_body: Shooter Avani Lekhara, who became the first Indian woman to win two gold medals at Paralympics in Tokyo, said the inclusivity of physically-challenged people is increasing day-by-day in India. "We are on a very good path and we'll see a more inclusive India in future," she added. Notably, the 20-year-old has booked her quota at 2024 Paris Paralympics.

374.title: 7 crypto billionaires' combined wealth falls to $31 bn from $145 bn in 7 months
374.article_body: The combined net worth of seven crypto billionaires has plunged from a peak of $145 billion in November 2021 to $31 billion, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao witnessed the biggest decline, with his net worth plunging from a high of $95.8 billion to $10.2 billion. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong's wealth fell $11.6 billion during this period.

375.title: Video shows Lawrence Bishnoi after arrest by Punjab Police in Moosewala murder case
375.article_body: A video shows gangster Lawrence Bishnoi after he was arrested by Punjab Police. He was produced in Delhi's Patiala House Court on Tuesday. The court allowed Punjab Police to formally arrest the gangster, who is an accused in Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case. The gangster was earlier lodged in Tihar jail in Delhi.

376.title: Cong leader criticises Delhi Police's food for detained workers, shares video
376.article_body: Congress leader Manickam Tagore on Tuesday criticised food provided by the Delhi Police to party leaders detained for protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. A video shared by him showed 'poori' and 'sabji' kept in two containers. He later shared another video of food provided by Delhi Congress chief Anil Chaudhary.

377.title: It's an investigative drama, I play a crime beat journalist: Yami on 'Lost'
377.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming film 'Lost', Yami Gautam said it's an investigative drama. "Tony da’s (Aniruddha) world you can imagine in a film like this, with a...realistic tone, a lot of human drama," she said. "I play a crime beat journalist in it and in its own subtle way it touches about media integrity in today’s time," she added.

378.title: Love is blind, stronger than love of parents & society: K'taka HC
378.article_body: The Karnataka High Court, while allowing a girl who eloped and married her lover to stay with him, said that the case depicted that love is blind, stronger than the love of parents and family members. "What they are doing to their parents today, they will get back exactly tomorrow," the court added.

379.title: PM Modi launches special stamp to mark 200th anniversary of Mumbai Samachar
379.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday released a special postal stamp commemorating the 200 years of the Mumbai Samachar newspaper. While addressing a gathering, PM Modi said, "Under the influence of foreigners, when this city became Bombay, even then this newspaper didn't leave its local connect." He added that regional newspapers played an important role in the Independence struggle.

380.title: J&K DGP reviews security arrangements ahead of Amarnath Yatra
380.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Director General of Police (DGP) Dilbag Singh on Tuesday chaired a high-level meeting of senior officers from Police, Civil administration and CAPFs ahead of the upcoming Amarnath Yatra. He reviewed the security arrangements and deployment of personnel for the yatra. Notably, the Amarnath Yatra will begin on June 30 and conclude after 43 days.

381.title: Pak to suffer like Sri Lanka if fuel subsidies not lifted: Minister
381.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said that the country's economy will default and suffer consequences like crisis-hit Sri Lanka if the government doesn't lift fuel subsidies. Ismail stated that the government was still providing a subsidy of PKR 19 on petrol and PKR 53 on diesel. The IMF won't sign deal with Pakistan if fuel prices aren't increased, he added.

382.title: WhatsApp allows users to transfer chat history from Android to iPhone
382.article_body: WhatsApp will now allow users to transfer their chat history, photos, videos, and voice messages from Android to iPhone, Mark Zuckerberg announced on Tuesday. "This is a top requested feature," the CEO of WhatsApp parent Meta Platforms said. Android users will be able to transfer their WhatsApp data to iPhone using Apple's 'Move to iOS' app, while maintaining end-to-end encryption.

383.title: Shirtless man climbs atop moving police car, breaks windshield in Hyd; video viral
383.article_body: A shirtless man, who was reportedly drunk, climbed atop a moving police vehicle in Hyderabad, a video of which is being widely shared online. He damaged the rear windshield of the patrol car, police said. A policeman reportedly thrashed the man with a plastic baton once he got down from the vehicle.

384.title: Red alert in Assam, Meghalaya for heavy rainfall over next 2 days: IMD
384.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued a red alert for heavy rainfall over most places in Assam and Meghalaya from June 15-16. An orange alert has been issued for the two states from Jun 17-18. IMD has also issued an orange alert for Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura till June 18 and for Arunachal Pradesh till June 17.

385.title: IPL becomes 2nd most valued sporting league as media rights sold for ₹48,390 crore
385.article_body: IPL overtook English Premier League to become the second-most valued sporting league in terms of per match value after its media rights were sold for ₹48,390 crore. IPL's TV rights (Package A) were bagged by Star India for ₹23,575 crore, amounting to ₹57.5 crore/match. Meanwhile, Viacom18 bagged digital rights (Package B and C) for ₹23,758 crore, amounting to ₹57.9 crore/match.

386.title: Kriti, Kartik, Farah remember Sushant on his 2nd death anniversary
386.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Kriti Sanon, Kartik Aaryan and Farah Khan took to social media to remember late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. Kriti shared a heart emoji with the song 'Darasal' from their 2017 film 'Raabta'. Kartik shared a picture of Sushant, writing in the caption, "Stars always shine no matter where they are."

387.title: Prime goal is to win two World Cups in next 18 months: Babar Azam
387.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said he'll consider his runs "worth gold" if he's able to achieve the prime goal of winning the two World Cups (T20 and ODI) for the side in next 18 months. Pakistan won T20 World Cup in 2009 under Younis Khan, while they won ODI World Cup in 1992 under their former Prime Minister Imran Khan.

388.title: Kyrgios only other player than Djokovic who can beat everyone on grass: Todd
388.article_body: Ex-Australia tennis player Todd Woodbridge has said if there is any player besides Novak Djokovic who can play well enough and beat everyone on grass, it's compatriot Nick Kyrgios. "He is a legitimate force and has a chance to go deep at Wimbledon," he added. Kyrgios best result at Wimbledon came in 2014, when he reached the quarter-finals.

389.title: My mom cried when she saw 48% in my prelim SSC result: Shilpa
389.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty has revealed that her mother producer Sunanda Shetty cried when she saw her SSC prelims report in which she had scored 48%. "My mom...bawled for the first time. She said you're going to be absolutely useless, worthless and nikammi," Shilpa added. The actress said that she then studied well for 10 days and scored a decent percentage.

390.title: He's busy with other issues: Thakur on Rahul's 'maha jumla' remark
390.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for calling Centre's announcement of recruitment of 10 lakh people in 18 months as "maha jumla". "Rather than welcoming the decision, he is too busy dealing with other issues to show his happiness towards this," Thakur said. "This is a government of not 'jumlas', but 'maha jumlas'," Rahul Gandhi tweeted earlier.

391.title: 3 brothers threaten to blow up district court in UP, arrested
391.article_body: Three brothers were arrested for threatening to blow up the UP district court premises and an armed police force deployed there, police said on Tuesday. SP Chakresh Mishra said that the three brothers, who were working as labourers, were in an inebriated state when they made the threat call. The trio regularly made such calls after consuming alcohol, he said.

392.title: Mumbai logs 1,724 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate rises to 15.58%
392.article_body: Mumbai has reported 1,724 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,240 recoveries and two deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's positivity rate on Tuesday has increased to 15.58%, compared to Monday's 11.6%. The number of active cases in Mumbai stands at 11,813. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in the city between June 7 and 13 was 0.149%.

393.title: Mumbai woman kills self, husband booked for abetment to suicide
393.article_body: The Bhandup police registered a case of abetment to suicide against a 28-year-old man for allegedly assaulting and harassing his 24-year-old wife, who died by suicide. The two got married in August 2020 without informing anyone, the police said. After a few months, there were regular arguments between them, during which the 28-year-old would manhandle the woman, police added.

394.title: PWD engineer arrested for accepting ₹40,000 bribe in MP's Bhopal
394.article_body: The Lokayukta Police arrested an executive engineer of Madhya Pradesh's Public Works Department (PWD) for accepting a bribe of ₹40,000 in Bhopal, an official said. A Rajgarh-based contractor had complained that the accused demanded ₹1 lakh "commission" for releasing security deposit kept against a contract work, police said. A case was registered under Prevention of Corruption Act, police added.

395.title: Drugs worth ₹8 lakh seized in Gujarat's Vadodara, 4 arrested
395.article_body: Police arrested four people in Gujarat's Vadodara and seized 81.04 gram of mephedrone drug worth ₹8 lakh, which they had allegedly procured from Madhya Pradesh, officials said. Vadodara Police's Special Operations Group (SOG) said the four accused, including a woman from Maharashtra, are part of the "Bichchhu Gang". With this, the police claimed to have busted an inter-state drug racket.

396.title: Flood control cell set up in Faridabad to monitor waterlogging
396.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon season, a flood control cell has been set up to deal with waterlogging in Faridabad, the city's Deputy Commissioner Jitender Yadav said. He also directed officials to ensure that all the cleaning works are completed before the monsoon season. Yadav said that over 100 civil defence volunteers will be roped in to assist the police.

397.title: 2 Mumbai men get 20 years in prison for minor's gangrape in 2017
397.article_body: A Special Mumbai court sentenced two men, Kiran Gaikwad and Ajay Waghmare, to 20 years of imprisonment for gangraping a minor in 2017. One of them had sexually assaulted the girl, while the other filmed the act. The court sentenced third accused Salim Ansari to three years in jail for harassing the girl by threatening to release the video.

398.title: South Africa to bowl first against India in third T20I, both sides unchanged
398.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in third T20I in Visakhapatnam. Both the playing XIs are unchanged. India stand-in captain Rishabh Pant mentioned that he would also have bowled first had he won the toss. South Africa lead the five-match series 2-0 after having won the T20Is in Delhi and Cuttack.

399.title: No DJs during Kanwar Yatra in Rajasthan: State Chief Secretary
399.article_body: The Rajasthan government has disallowed the use of DJs during the Kanwar Yatra held in the state. According to the state government, vehicles with DJs mounted on them will be confiscated by police. State Chief Secretary Usha Sharma, while announcing the decision, asked police officers to emphasise coordination with people to avoid communal incidents.

400.title: President Kovind attends 'Lokarpana' of ISKCON temple in B'luru
400.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday attended the 'Lokarpana' of ISKCON Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple in Bengaluru on Tuesday. According to ISKCON (International Society for Krishna Consciousness), Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple on Kanakapura Road is a traditional, stone-carved structure and a replica of the famous Sri Venkateswara temple in Andhra Pradesh.

401.title: Not letting Ajit Pawar speak at PM's event is Maha's insult: Sule
401.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Supriya Sule on Tuesday said that not letting Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar speak at inauguration of Pune's Sant Tukaram Shila temple is an insult to the state. "A request was made to the PMO to allow [Pawar] to speak, but [there was no response]," Sule added. PM Narendra Modi attended the ceremony earlier today.

402.title: Thieves steal gold, diamond jewellery worth ₹4 cr in Mumbai, arrested
402.article_body: Police on Tuesday said three persons have been arrested for allegedly stealing gold and diamond jewellery worth ₹4 crore from a rented premises in south Mumbai. Deepak Jain, the complainant, claimed that his father "appeared in his dream", asking him to visit the room and collect the "treasure". Jain did not find the jewellery when he reached the room.
